Reviews.Title: “The Eden made for a wonderfully romantic stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: richncik
Reviews.Content: We decided to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversry by staying at the Eden for three nights.We chose it because it seemed to excel in its offer, has a strong history, with many famous people having stayed there, and although now part of a larger group (Le Meriden part of the Starwood empire) actually appears small and boutique-like From reading other reviews on Tripadviosr I contacted the hotel in advance and requested a room with a balcony. We were delighted by the reception we received on arrival, spontaneously congratulating us. Our room was delightful, situated on the 5th floor and with marvellous views of the Vatican area, and other famous areas. As requested our room had a balcony. A bottle of champagne on ice was soon brought to the room with a red rose and a welcoing hand written note from the manager! Such a lovely touch. We were very impressed with the overall quality of service, which was impeccable. You are made to feel like royalty! Concirege and reception were most helpful in giving advice on where to eat / visit. Nothing was too much for them. The restaurant was fantastic with stunning panoramic views over the city, and the food was very good indeed. On our last evening, we decided to have dinner in the restaurant La Terrazza dell'Eden and chose the Gourmet menu. It made for a memorable conclusion to a wonderfully romantic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not the paradise I thought it would be”
Reviews.Author: MoHop
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two nights while touring Italy. We wanted to stay at top hotels as we were willing to splurge and really celebrate on this trip. The concierge was friendly, informative and attentive. The lobby impressive and clean. Restaurant/bar/garden on top floor was elegant with beautiful views of the city. However, the size of our deluxe room very disappointing ... quoted at @ 344 feet, it felt like a box with no extra sitting area/space. We expected a bigger bedroom/living space for this very pricy, deluxe room that was advertised as spacious. The balcony had french windows that opened up to a large window ... not a true balcony to sit out on, which we had hoped for. The bathroom and closet area was roomy and that must have made up much of the square footage. Additionally, the room faced the street and both mornings at @ 6 a.m. you could hear the garbage and recycling trucks across the street doing their thing for about 15-20 minutes, which really annoyed us since we wanted to sleep in a bit. Aside from that, great location. We had some odd encounters too ... like upon arrival they could not accommodate an early check in as requested (@10:30 a.m.) and were told to come back around 2 pm. Upon our return, we were very excited to shower since it had been a long trip. Unfortunately, a water pipe had burst at that moment and we could not use water for about two hours. When we checked out a false fire alarm went off and we had to evacuate our room to the panic of alarms and announcements. All in all it did not feel like a 5-star hotel because of the room size and the price attached to this box-of-a-deluxe room. We felt it did not match the room description on the hotel website accurately. You can probably get more for your money at other 4-5 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Eden”
Reviews.Author: UK_AS
Reviews.Content: Nothing but praise. Service was of the highest order. Breakfast in the overpriced restaurant was excellent and views to die for. All staff we encountered were brilliant and we shall return. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Shana14_11
Reviews.Content: The Eden hotel was amazing! The hotel staff made us feel so special. The location is perfect...walking distance to everything we wanted: shopping, dining, and night ife. Fabrizio found all of the perfect restaurants for us. The rooftop bar has friendly staff and sunset views of Rome. Ahhhhh...I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Elli J
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we felt at home. The staff had a way of making us feel so special in every way. The front of house was so warm and welcoming especially the concierge, Fabrizio who was so knowledgable about everything. The Roman style rooms were adorable. The rooftop bar is breathtaking and offered delicious small plates. This was one of the best trips of my life and can't wait to return. Thank you for an unforgettable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Top rated hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Theodore D
Reviews.Content: For the last 4 years travelling to Rome, the Eden hotel has maintained a consistent and stellar service provider as would be expected of A Luxury Hotel service. From Francesco the bellman and Alessandro the Concierge to Pietro running operations and Mr. Levy overseeing the entire property, my experience at the Eden is nothing short of superb. Congratulations to a real First Class property with first class service and professionalism. i would recommend the Eden to tourist and business executives alike given the capabilities and service of the entire Eden team!!!

Reviews.Title: “amazing weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: meiandmyself
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, amazing staff, superb view from the roof terrace. Ok, the rooms are not huge but definitely worth it! and the location is just the best to be honest... you are right in the center, but it is quiet with the parc next door... just loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Our memorable stay at Hotel Eden”
Reviews.Author: freud50
Reviews.Content: The hotel Eden has superb, warm and competent personnel. Management is omnipresent and very accommodating. The concierge desk is one of the most helpful and dedicated that we have experienced in our travels. The hotel is impeccably maintained and very clean. It is extremely well located, within walking distance of the main sites. Breakfasts in their beautiful top floor restaurant were outstanding. Some of the rooms need renovating and the rooms at the front of the hotel can be very noisy even though the street is a side street. Do request a quiet room on the courtyard if this is important to you (but, you'll have to give up the view). My wife and I and our 14 year old grandson spent 12 nights at the Eden Hotel in March 2012. We loved it and would not hesitate to recommend this wonderful hotel to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice, especially the resto”
Reviews.Author: Benji_kt
Reviews.Content: Rooms were perfect for what we needed although I would say a touch corporate. We had one (516 I believe) with a balcony and a view across Rome to die for. Top floor resto was tremendous. Literally couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for walking”
Reviews.Author: Noneofyourbiz
Reviews.Content: Superb service without being stuffy. The hotel was in the PERFECT location! Walking distance to all the "famous" attractions. While in walking distance to many of the busy attractions, it's located on a very quite street. We stayed in room 603 which had a spectacular view. The view made up for the somewhat small room size (even though it was considered an upgraded room). We had friends who stayed in room 535. Their room was larger without the view. While I think the hotel is worth the splurge (comfort & cleanliness is EVERYTHING to me), beware of the hotel bar. I thought the prices were outrageous! For instance: a shot of lemoncello was 12 euros; a cup of cappuccino & an espresso was 15 euros. I expect to pay a little more at a hotel bar or restaurant, but I found this is to be a little over the top. In summary, you can't go wrong with this hotel -- extremely comfortable beds, top notch service, great amenities in the bathrooms, bar a little pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: livingitlarge
Reviews.Content: Just back from a lovely long weekend in Rome, where we stayed at the gorgeous Hotel Eden which is located at the top of the Spanish Steps in a quieter portion of town, yet still in the middle of the city. The friendly and helpful staff showed us to our lovely King sized room looking out onto the street. The room had large opening windows, which I always love to see in a hotel - great to get some fresh air. The room had all that you would expect from a 5* hotel, including gorgeous Penhaligons Quercus bathroom products. They also provide lovely dark coloured monogramed slippers to slide into after your day sightseeing around Rome (which, of course, came home with me!). There was wifi for a charge in the room, but free wifi in the luxurious lobby - great to sit on the plush sofas and check your email. There was a seriously gorgeous roof terrace on the 6th floor, with amazing views out to all of Rome. Nothing is allowed to be built higher than the cross on the Vatican, so there are no sky-scrapers to spoil the view. We splurged on a cocktail on the roof terrace and were provided with silver dishes of chips, olives and nibbles - very nice. If I'm looking for a negative it would only be minor, the marble bathroom has the obligatory huge shower head, but no real water pressure - it took a while to wash the shampoo out of my hair. And, just for laughs, they have the most expensive breakfast I've ever seen in a hotel anywhere in the world, E53 for a basic hot breakfast for one person! Of course, we didn't order it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Eden Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BernardusDc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eden March 4 - 11, 2012. Everyone at the hotel, particularly the desk staff and the concierge, is friendly and quite helpful. The location is fantastic -- just below the Borghese Gardens, and a short walk to either the Spanish Steps or the Via Veneto. And, as others have commented, the views from the top floor restaurant are delightful. We were staying at the hotel using Starwood points, but from the moment we arrived until our departure, we felt like honored guests. Our room, a "deluxe double," had two terraces and a walk-in closet and was very quiet and comfortable. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel un Rome”
Reviews.Author: Marie-Claude S
Reviews.Content: When I go to Rome, I always stay at the Eden Hotel. The location is perfect and the view from the restaurant is one of the best in Rome. The staff is very helpful and polite particularly the concierge Bernardo, who is always cheerful and so nice.

Reviews.Title: “lovely setting--pay extra for a view room/high floor!”
Reviews.Author: Windsor19
Reviews.Content: The ambiance that this hotel strives to reach seems to be-- peace and tranquility amongst the bustle of the busy city. The lobby has a small upscale boutique feel and the views from the restaurant on the 6th floor are amazing! (The breakfast buffet/service is also TOP NOTCH!) The front desk staff, concierge and bell/doormen are all very polite and helpful. Upon checkin we were personally walked up to our room. The 1st room we were given was on the 5th floor. It was very large w/a separate parlor and entry area. The window opened to an odd triangular shaped garden/shaft. I prefer to look out and around at the city so the front desk staff was gracious enough to move us to a smaller room with a window that faced outside the building. Our second room was clean and nice (large bathroom!) but definetly not overwhelming or outstanding.The view was sub-par to say the least. Being on the third floor our room overlooked the sometimes noisy street, parking garage with a view of the large tree and apartments nearby. My husband is a very frequent traveler w/SPG and 99.9% of the time we are upgraded to excellent rooms. My high expectations were dashed for this hotel stay. It is now day three of our six night stay and I find that I love walking into the hotel but am disappointed once in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Edobrov
Reviews.Content: We went for a family trip last summer, for a view days. It was a great hotel. The staff was amazing, and friendly. The concierge services by far beats any that I have experienced. It was located in the perfect location, near all the attractions. The view from the room was amazing, one of the best in rome. We had the view directly on the dome of St. Peter's Basilica. In addition, you had the chance to experience the same view while having a wonderful Italian breakfast on the top floor. Well, one actually saw the whole Rome! Truly inspiring and amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Sara705
Reviews.Content: Absolutly perfect and warming in welcoming guests, they make you feel like a friend without losing a formal touch

Reviews.Title: “Trouble in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: DramaQueenFlip
Reviews.Content: I reviewed the Eden Hotel last 18 October 2011 after our stay last 3-7 October 2011. My review was very favorable as we had a fantastic time at the Eden with the luxurious accommodations and very attentive staff. However I only discovered recently that one of my friends lost her mobile phone at the hotel. She had left it charging in her room when she went to meet us for breakfast at La Terrazza and when she returned, it was gone. She felt that it wasn't worth mentioning at the time because it was only a very cheap back-up mobile phone and the loss would have ruined our vacation. It was her husband, who wasn't with us on the trip, who let the story slip. I personally feel so disappointed because I really enjoyed staying at the Eden, and the level of service given by the staff (from the concierges, to the restaurants, to the front desk, to housekeeping and the door men) were exceptional. I had thought to return to Eden this June but my friend's experience has changed my mind.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Peripatetic12
Reviews.Content: Location is superb, room was comfortable...but the hotel atmosphere was expectional. I particularly enjoyed sitting in hotel lobby in the evening watching and listening to the hotel patrons come and go. Views from the roof-top bar and resturant were spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Solice in the middle of Rome's hustle and bustle.”
Reviews.Author: JoeandJan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Eden twice during our recent visit to Italy. Upon arrival, we were pleasantly greeted by the front desk staff and despite my feigned attempts at the Italian language, the young lady checking us in moved to English with a smile. As a Starwood Platinum, I was upgraded to one of the Ambassador Suites, specifically #107. We were pleasantly surprised to see a two level accommodation with a spiral staircase leading to a terracotta tiled terrace. Unfortunately, this was February however it made me think about how nice this would be in the warmer months. The room was clean and well appointed, the bed comfortable, the marble bath was luxurious. The staff were very pleasant and accommodating to our needs from the front desk, to housekeeping, concierge and doormen. Always a pleasant greeting while either leaving or returning to the hotel. We did not eat at the hotel during our stay, but did enjoy La Terrazza. Drinks were pricey, but the view and atmosphere made it all worth the cost. There are several bars within about a 3 minute walk that were great for a light breakfast and a few very good and reasonably priced restaurants nearby as well. Excellent location within an easy walk to some of Rome's main attractions like the Pantheon, Piazza Navonna, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and Via Veneto. Hotel Eden is tucked away on a very quiet street far enough away from the hustle and bustle, yet in the center of it all. We returned to Hotel Eden for our last night in Italy and it proved that our first experience wasn't a fluke. During our stay we walked into several other upscale hotels for comparison's sake and were please with our choice. When returning to Rome, the Hotel Eden would be a top choice.

Reviews.Title: “A++”
Reviews.Author: Susan C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this property 24 -28 January 2012. We planned 4 days in Rome before moving to Florence for a week. I can tell you, as we both travel a great deal, a sure sign of a great stay is when its tough to leave! As many of you know, Rome is amazing but The Hotel Eden and its staff were in perfect rhythm with the city. From the front door Nicoletta and her team never missed a beat to graciously answer our questions or take care of anything we needed. The Eden is beautifully located for shopping, great restaurants, and so much of the glory Rome has to offer. We walked The Vatican to the Colosseum from our front door returning to their roof top bar to toast the day. Here you can review your days trek.. the view is unmatched. We would without reservations recommend The Eden. Thanks to all.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty much without fault”
Reviews.Author: curlycue
Reviews.Content: what a lovely old world place this is. they could not have been more helpful and we loved our breakfast. yes, it is very expensive but I don't go to Rome often and the location of the Eden is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware of the room you get”
Reviews.Author: Longhini
Reviews.Content: I'm in Rome typically yearly and I've stayed twice at Eden Hotel. The first time I was on the 3rd floor facing the gardens and it was WONDERFUL. This past trip I was on the first floor just above the storage room (room 107). It was extremely loud due to the noise underneath and woke me up on a regular basis. The hotel itself is lovely, the staff is impecible and the location can't be beat. I will certainly return to the hotel but I will try not to stay on the 1st floor again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome...just don't have breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Barcelona-Dreamin
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pure Italian Luxury. The decor, the staff and the room were all five stars. Located a little bit out of the center, it should not pose a problem once you return to the quiet of the hotel after a long day of sightseeing. Breakfast was a little pricey...about 70 euros per person. The American newlywed couple complaining about their eggs didn't help either! But the view made up for it. You are close to the Via Vittorio Veneto which has all the posh shops and restaurants you will ever need. If planning a honeymoon to Rome...Eden will not let you down.

Reviews.Title: “Our first trip to Rome and the Eden Hotel was more than what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Sofia G
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, helpfull concierge, elegant lobby, the best martini and gourmet dinning on the top floor. The excellent location allowed us to "discover" the sorroundings of the Spanish Steps area. Our room on the fith floor was comfortable and had a view of the "tip" of the Vatican. We certainly recommend it and look forwrad to our next visit. Sofia & Robert

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: FilmTraveller
Reviews.Content: The location is everything about this hotel, a short walk from the Spanish Steps and not far from the Borghese Gardens. The reception staff were courteous and formal. The concierge is charming and efficient. Ask for recommendations, and you'll be well guided. The atmosphere is slightly more 'international hotel', and less old-style Rome than we had hoped. Rooms are clean, generous and well fitted, though we asked for a quieter room and so found ourselves looking into the light well. If you want views, you risk the noise, but we would do that then next time. The great plus here is that fabulous roof restaurant and terrace. You have views over a Rome that dreams are made of, past the grand villas and on towards the Forum, the Vatican...everything. None of this comes cheap, but it is worth the cash for the luxurious location with a glass of champagne at cocktail hour; or a pot of coffee at breakfast - to plan your day with the guide book and look up to chart your route. A great base for a long weekend stay, but not necessarily a hotel to hang out in.

Reviews.Title: “A touch of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Loverly4u2
Reviews.Content: Beautiful,old style hotel with AAA service, spotlessly clean and the right touch of sophistication, luxury and class. A bit expensive with average sized rooms (slightly stuffy) but all together a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Roman elegance”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy W
Reviews.Content: The best thing to be said for the Hotel is it's location, only minutes from the Spanish steps, the Via Venetto and the Borghese Park. It was very confortable and the service was good and my criticisms are small - but I think important. Because the bar and Restaurant are on the top floor, the main reception area does feel a touch sterile. The room was perfectly nice but I was not terribly happy with the climate control. We visited in November and the weather was, by English standards, quite warm. The room therefore was rather hot and stuffy but because of the time of year, the aircon had been disabled and was set only for heat generation. The only way to get air therefore, was to open the window and Rome, being Rome, is very noisy. What made this even more irritating was the sound of an air conditioner starting up every half hour or so - probably the Hotel Managers suite! The Bar and Restaurant are, as mentioned, at the top of the Hotel and have wonderful views of Rome and they are very expensive - but, Hey, it is a 5* Hotel! Overall, I would thoroughly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a classic 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: lsacpa
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Hotel Eden and could not have been more pleased. In addition to the classic elegance of the property, what makes the place a true 5 star facility is the people. From the front desk to the housekeeping, to the every present and wondrously helpful concierge, you are always treated as a valued guest. The location is also great; just a few minutes from the Spanish Steps, Trevino Fountain and Via Veneto. When the next opportunity arises for a trip to Rome, Eden better have a room available for my wife and I.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great staff and service!”
Reviews.Author: mdluvs2shop
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at Hotel Eden in Rome November 12-17th. The hotel is gorgeous! The hotel was SPOTLESS, roomy and comfortable. The lobby, bar, restaurant and rooms were ALWAYS clean. They had a very nice business center if you wanted/needed to use a computer. The entire staff at this hotel were friendly, polite and ever so helpful. They open the front doors wearing tuxedos with top hats, they greet you and are there to help you with anything you might need. The conceirge was so helpful with restaurant recommendations and reservations. He set us up with an excellent guide of the Vatican (Museum, Sistine chaple and St. Peter's square). The hotel is located within walking distance of the Spanish Steps, Trevi fountain, great resaurants and shopping. The only tip I have is to double check your invoice. They billed my roommate twice and didn't bill me at all. It was an easy mistake and easily rectified between friends. We really wanted for nothing and if we did...they were there to make sure we had it! Thank you to the entire hotel staff at Hotel Eden for making our stay wonderful. Great location, service and staff. Grazie!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service & Location but... VERY PRICEY!!!”
Reviews.Author: natalie s
Reviews.Content: The eden hotel is in a great location ( trevi fountain 5 mins away walking) and i can not fault the service in the hotel, although it comes at a price. I found all services such as room service and ironing service to be very expensive. I didnt expect it to be cheap as it is a 5 star hotel but i think 35 euro for a club sandwich is way too much. Hotel is very 'italian' which was new to me as id only stayed in very modern 5 stars before....very nice but i thought rooms looked a little tired. Staff are very friendly and concierge cannot do enough for you. Food is excellent, cleanliness excellent. i would recommend eden hotel...

Reviews.Title: “One night was not enough.”
Reviews.Author: CarolTucker
Reviews.Content: We stayed two days and one night in Rome before flying home after traveling for a week in Umbria. I used some of our Starwood points and booked the Hotel Eden. It is a beautiful property at the top of a hill near the Borghese Gardens, away from much of the rush of Rome. We were able to park our rental car right in front of the hotel since we were only staying for one night. Our bags were stored securely the first morning while we waited for our room to be ready and we walked the city, and also after we checked out and until we left for the Rome airport the next afternoon. As a Hospitality Instructor, I have toured many wonderful properties, but it was a real pleasure to stay in one that lived up to it's reputation. The front desk employees couldn't have been more attentive, and the handwritten note from our room attendant was a sweet surprise. Delicious chocolates and a lovely up-to-date bathroom with attractive ammenities added to our stay. I just wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel in an amazing city!”
Reviews.Author: tom t
Reviews.Content: We stayed for our first time in Rome. It could not been better! We loved the people, the monuments, heritage sites, and of course the food! In top of that have enjoyed a lot our Hotel Eden! it is located only few minutes walk from the top of Spanish steps and via veneto! the location in perfect! The Hotel in quite small, like a boutique Hotel! For this reason you feel like at home! each staff member is very well trained and they remembered every time our name! that is rare to find everywhere in the world. \ Finally we did not find any complaints to make. If we would like to make an exception... we could only say that the HOtel does not have a Spa...but you do not go to Rome to find spa...you have so much to see in the city! We can only say see you soon Eden!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable base in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Solaqne71
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situated for both tourists and business people. The roof-top restaurant is one of the best in the world, with spectacular views of the city and exceptionally good food. The breakfast buffet there is also wonderful. The staff is courteous, helpful and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: JTraveler0000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel during our honeymoon and we had a wonderful experience. We arrived to find that we were upgraded to a larger room which was beautifully decorated and was a nice size (which surprised me as I heard the hotel was in need of a renovation before we arrived - so perhaps we got a newer room). The hotel has a gym, steam room, and business center (which was invaluable to use as we didn't do much planning before we arrived!). My only complaints are that the bed was not very comfortable, the sheets were extremely scratchy, and the staff other than reception were not the most friendly people. But otherwise I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mhh49
Reviews.Content: We only had 2 days in Rome but our stay at the Eden was wonderful....outstanding service and beautiful room. The rooftop dining room and bar were elegant and the view was spectacular. The attention to detail is what sets this hotel apart. I cannot say enough about how helpful the staff was especially the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Hotel very well located in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: impytraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of our trip and it was lovely to experience such luxury. Really. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. It was almost overwhelming to stay at this hotel. In a good way (I think). The room we had was comfortable and it was the only place we stayed at that had a bathtub which was lovely after walking around Rome all day!! We used points to stay at this hotel and I can safely say that otherwise it would have been out of our chosen price range. I did, at times, felt "underdressed" as I tend towards sporty/sporty casual. The location was amazing! Near the Spanish steps and the subway as well as numerous great places to eat at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: cspowell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this incredible hotel in May 2011. During my stay the President of Argentina as well as Mr. Bulgari were staying there as well. We had very friendly service. Everything was impeccable. The hotel is beautiful but very comfortable. The restuarant had very good food. Location very nice and quiet but clothes to busy fun areas including the Spanish steps. Hotel Eden is a truly beautiful hotel with impeccable service.

Reviews.Title: “amazing classic European luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jacques B
Reviews.Content: I visited Rome with friends in October which i believe is one of the best month to travel in Ethernal city. We have chosed the Eden for its history, location, service tradition and the fine restaurant. Coming back home we can say, with our happiness, that we did the right choice! The Eden is one of the few classic luxury Hotel that is still keeping the secret for how to treat guests, taking care of them anytime. The staff is always there to help you, from the doormen, to the front office team ending with the bar and restaurant people. Furthermore, We had the most cleaned rooms ever had in any other hotel in the past. Finally we thank tripadvisor! Everybody now can share his personal experience with others...this is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Bellissimo!”
Reviews.Author: Lorrigm
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Eden's elegant ambiance and the fantastic location. The accommodations were wonderful.We were also impressed by the extraordinary staff, everyone made us feel very welcome where ever we went in the hotel. The concierge desk was especially helpful, my Mother-In-Law has to have a Gluten Free diet and they were so accommodating with great suggestions and handling our dinner reservations requests. We really enjoyed the rooftop resturant La Terrazza with it's beautiful views of Rome, they had wonderful Gluten Free Bread and gulten free selections for my Mother-In-Law.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in europe”
Reviews.Author: charlize g
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler and my standards are high and I must say I have never had a more consistent top notch stay in a hotel anywhere!!! From the impeccable service to friendly staff to wonderful food and exquisitely designed rooms - especially the bathrooms! - the list goes on and on. Coming from Europe, I must say without hesitation, this was the best hotel I have ever stayed at in Rome. The small details like the courtesy car only add to the feeling of being at a private residence and the boutique hotel atmosphere was reinforced every morning being greeted by the same friendly faces.. A huge congratulations to management and staff for making my stay so perfect! I must thank the concierge, after eating 2 times in their beautiful restaurant I have asked for a suggestion on which restaurant to choose, they have advised me Porto di Ripetta Restaurant it was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Magical environment and views!”
Reviews.Author: Wjm420
Reviews.Content: Eden is a small beautiful property located on top of a hill. The rooftop restaurant and bar has incredible views. We started each day with breakfast overlooking Rome, then we had sunset in the bar as we rested from our sightseeing. The staff is lovely. Our room was much bigger than we expected. The location was perfect. The hotel is very special.

Reviews.Title: “vacation with friends”
Reviews.Author: Barbara K
Reviews.Content: I think the Eden is an elegant property that has retained it's dignity and charm at a time when service is no longer. The staff is warm and friendly, the rooms are large, and the best thing is the breakfast in their roof top restaurant, overlooking the city. Because it's a 5 star, it's pricey, but you get what you pay for. The rooms are clean and warmly decorated. Overall, so comfortable!!

Reviews.Title: “Honey Moon Experience”
Reviews.Author: Nima1639
Reviews.Content: Being a Young travelers on our Honeymoon we weren't expecting a fairy tale experience. We were right we found the hotel staff to be extremely rude and unhelpful except for the concierge. The other hotel staff acted like they were doing us a favor by just talking to us. They do not know how to properly greet their guests or even smile. Not sure if it was because we were young but this was our honeymoon and I am Starwood Gold member. We were put directly underneath a room that was having construction being done to it. We were woken up at 7 am to pounding and hammering for the first two day we were there. After complaint to hotel management Mr. Pietro his first remark was this hotel is open 24 hours a day and we cannot close it for repairs. I had to educate this highly ranked manager of a category 6 Starwood hotel that you don't need to close your hotel just do not people directly underneath it especially if they plan on hammering away at 7 in the morning. I had to complain to starwood corporate for the manager to even acknowledge my complaints. We then decided to cancel the rest of our stay and move to the Hassler hotel. Them Knowing this was going to be our last night there because of our horrible room location they finally decided to move our room. Our room would not have been changed if I didn't call Starwood corporate numerous times to complain about Mr. Pietro's Arrogance. Also the hotel bed sheets felt like sand paper , the room was very loud and noisy due to it being located in front of tour bus stops and having single pained windows , the restaurant had great views but the food was just average. Would strongly recommend the Hotel Hassler which is actually on the Spanish steps not three blocks from it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: yourdaisyjane
Reviews.Content: From the beautifully appointed and cared for guest rooms to the gracious and welcoming public spaces - Hotel Eden is a jewel. The location is perfect - walking distance to all of the major sights and along the bus line when your feet get too tired to walk anymore. We would absolutely stay here again and recommend it to anyone headed to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and great location but....”
Reviews.Author: phillip_norton
Reviews.Content: I had a tough time with my overall rating of this hotel and wanted to be fair. I was struggling between average and very good. I don't think average is quite fair and very good maybe overly generous. So it is somewhere in between. This is a beautiful hotel in a fantastic location in the heart of Rome near the Via Veneto. Accessible to nearly every major attraction and most of them easily by foot. The rooftop restaurant has stunning views (and stunning prices) of Rome. You are right around the corner from the Spanish Steps. I booked this well in advance as this was a 10 year anniversary trip to Italy. We had eaten dinner there 6 years ago on our last trip to Rome and had always wanted to stay there. The concierge were nice and helpful. It is a very expensive place and the rooms are small for the price you pay, but we tried not to spend too much time in the rooms any way. We had one complaint about the hotel. We have two young children at home and one of them wasn't feeling well so we decided to check out a day early. As I mentioned we had booked well in advance, and we had prepaid the room. I tried to get them to give us credit or any consideration since they were getting the room back over a day early (as we left the hotel at 4:30am). They were very unaccommodating and I made a point in saying I am not asking for you to refund a nights stay but some consideration. They were very abrupt and completely unhelpful. I would NOT recommend anyone stay there because of that reason along with the size of rooms. As I mentioned the location was amazing and the rooms are nice, but very small. I was soured on the Hotel by the way we were handled and the stuffiness of the front desk/reception personnel. They were very cold. After that discussion the night before the front desk person when we checked out was also very unfriendly. I would also like to repeat the concierge people were very friendly and helpful. I know of other people who swear by this hotel. We have stayed at the Hassler and here and much prefer the Hassler.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel In Rome”
Reviews.Author: GelatoDuo
Reviews.Content: The Eden Hotel is a jewel in the Dolce Vita area of Rome. When we arrived we were greeted by the most welcoming people, there was a smile on everyones face, and an offer to help with restaurant recommendations and any of our needs while we were guests in the hotel. The rooms were lovely and the attention to detail exceptional. The hotel is in walking distance of the Borghese Gardens and the area was quiet and peaceful after a day of sightseeing. There is a beautiful restaurant on the rooftop with a panoramic view of Rome. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel, it is elegant and lovely and we would go back as soon as we can repack our suitcases. A special thank you to Fabio & the Bernardo's you are all fantastic !!

Reviews.Title: “A fitting end to a special trip”
Reviews.Author: DINKYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Orient Express rail journey from London( Grosvenor Victoria ) to Venice ( Cipriani) then Eurostar down to Rome to Party....a great start,....the Eden didnt spoil the finale! Location - Not as great as you would like...but taxis are around and actually the top end of Rome isnt that shabby (or touristy)...just not so full of life....Spanish steps are 8 mins walk away (down hilll) - local Bar/.cafe (turn left out of the door and 150 metre up the road ..Cafe Ludovski??) is a good local staple for pre dinner beer/Early morning cafe with the locals - on the sidestreet opposite the cafe is a bar where you sit on the pavement, get served by a lovely and friendly bar maid - in terms of value the best measure for me was seeing the local bus boys and waiters come here for their "shot" of life between shifts ...it aint posh but a nice way of escaping the bubble for a while. Service - Personal....a nice word in a cold world...no feeling of large corporate here, just well trained "people" who want to /or appear to want to help...not quite home but certainly made to feel welcome and able to relax...and in some style - reception/Concierge/Doorman(doesnt do justice but not sure of proper title) and especially the Bar and waiitng staff in La Terrazza were fabulous. - Superb Cocktails Rooms - We had courtyard views on the second floor..In hindsight and if you can upgrade you will benefit Im sure - but this standard of room is of nice standard - only issue is that the main reception (ground 0)is a temple of Cool Marble whilst the entertainment centre (Bar) is on the 6th. So you spend alot of time in the lift Value - We were a party of 4 in the mood to celebrate and therefroe this was not a priority - I have spent more in places and felt less satisfied therefore I feel it was worth it - it has been a week since we returned so I feel some of the rose tinting/hangover has faded - however for several moments I was alllowed to feel a sense of international "playboy" at this special hotel without ever feeling frustrated or ripped off...I know this seems an odd metric to use but for this weekend it was exactly what we wanted and as such have nothing but fond memories..but take your your own pinch of salt and decide what you want...if this is your first/only trip to Rome then this might be a little off the beaten track ( but use Google Earth not my measure of distance before you decide....does anyone know where the centre of Rome is by the way??) - Gourmet Dinner with Flight of wine was 165 Euro a head in La Terrazza when we were there.....and most excellent it was to Alternatives - Have stayed at the "Exedra" before and found it a beautfiul bulding with better rooms (in our case) but worse/differnt location - the fact you walk past the "Hassler" as you go down the spanish steps has got to raise the question ...why didnt I stay there? (its a bit stuffy but Im sure a couple Martinis would change that ) In short - a rare touch of exceeding expectations, based on the staff as opposed to the bricks, mortar and marble - will struggle next time we go to a 5 star for 2 days where everyone doesnt know your name. If work pay I'll go to the Eden, If we go as a couple Im too nosey and would need to see if the Hassler or Russie match up The fact you've read this probably means you've booked or are about to...I say go for it ....and make friends when you there to get the best out the place Tip - The hop on/hop off bus that starts outside the hotel is a good audio tour but gets very busy (as Im sure they all do) so its more a case of hop on...stay on until you've done a circuit whilst keeping your seat ..then get off - not a big problem but take a coat /jumper and dont kid yourself you are the only people wanting to see this fabulous city

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother - Many other choices”
Reviews.Author: 21ice
Reviews.Content: My wife and I began our two week Italian vacation with 2 nights/days at the St. Regis Grand Hotel and ended with three nights/days at the Eden Hotel in Rome. We used our Starwood points to pay for one of the nights at the Eden. Upon checking in, the two desk women were disinterested in our arrival and appeared inconvenienced (it was 2 PM so maybe we interupted their afternoon break). We asked about internet service and were told it was available for 15 euro a day. As a Starwood preferred guest I asked if we were entitled to free internet service (the room was very expensive as well) and I was told no, nothing they can do. We were then led to a VERY small room, with a bottle of champagne, in a bucket of melted ice and a wilted rose in a vase along with a note addressed to another person. I said this must be the wrong room but was told this was indeed the room for us and the woman left, leaving the champagne, note card and rose behind. The next day we were having lunch near the Parliment building and a young American couple was seated next to us. As it happens they too were staying at the Eden and also thought the staff was rude and indifferent during their checkin process. The Hotel Splendide is around the corner and they fell over each other to greet us when we arrived to have cocktails at their rooftop bar called Mirabella. Basically, you have many hotel options withing a few blocks of the Eden and I would suggest you look at those choices because YOU ARE THE CUSTOMER and deserve excellent service. The only sour note in what was a wonderful vacation. We love Italy and look forward to returning soon!

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to its name!”
Reviews.Author: DramaQueenFlip
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eden from Oct 3 to Oct 7. Upon check-in we were graciously welcomed by the reception staff and escorted to our room. The room was smaller than the room we enjoyed at the last hotel we had stayed in (Softel The Grand Amsterdam) but it was understandable since Rome has very limited space. Despite the diminution in size, the room was well appointed and comfortable. There was no complimentary water so it was good that there was a small grocery nearby where we were able to buy water and snacks. The hotel is very near the Spanish Steps and Via Condotti, and from there it's quite easy to walk to other areas. The housekeeping staff were zealous in maintaining cleanliness in the rooms and in the hallways. The Terraza at the rooftop where breakfast was served everyday and where we also had several lunches and dinners had a beautiful view of Rome's skyline. The staff at the restaurant were quite friendly and efficient and the food was delicious. I cannot say enough about the concierges Alessandro and Bernardo. Alitalia had misplaced one of our suitcases and upon filling in a form at the airport, they told us that they would forward the luggage to our hotel. Alessandro and Bernardo were most solicitous in following up Alitalia for us constantly and patient in reassuring us about our misplaced luggage. Bernardo was so joyful when it finally arrived and he even called us at our room to inform us about it. When we discovered that Alitalia had damaged the lock on our suitcase and requested Alessandro to send out someone to find us a lock that would fit, he did so immediately. The bellboy that he sent went to four different stores but was unsuccessful but when I met him at the elevator, he was cheerful about his fruitless search and seemed surprised and quite pleased when we gave him a tip upon check-out. Bernardo also recommended an excellent restaurant to us for dinner, Girarostro da Fiorentino, which was 10 minutes away from the hotel. When we left a tip with Alessandro for the concierge staff, he too acted surprised and appreciative. Our stay in Rome was definitely made enjoyable by the accommodations provided by Eden Hotel and its wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “4.5 Stars, Near Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Alex B
Reviews.Content: My wife and i went for a belated honeymoon, This was the last 4 days of a two week Sicily and Rome vacation. Truly amazing property and stunning location, and a great way to end our trip. Our room was not a suite but it was relatively large and on the carpeted side of the building (so no noise problems like a couple of the other reviewers described). Also, we had a nice view over the gardens of Villa Ludovisi. The concierge was helpful and friendly but to be honest nothing out of the ordinary. Overall, it is really close to a full five star hotel but service was a little erratic, and for any extras you are going to pay dearly. They messed up on a wake up call, we almost missed a tour, and we got a bottle of prosecco and plate of fruits on the house, and they replaced the fruits every day we were there! Nice gesture for sure, but shouldn't the (inexpensive) bottle of prosecco have been in our room upon check-in anyway? I got an internet nonrefundable rate and to their credit, even if they did not treat us like visiting royalty they certainly treated us like regular guests most of the time (save the lack of any gift upon check in, esp. considering this was our honeymoon, see last sentence). It seems like between special rates, leading hotels and Amex vacations everyone there is on upgrade, so look for the deal, but it is definitely a worthy treasure and certainly great on a business account too. Of course, the restaurant was incredible and worth every penny. I must say it was some of the most attentive, yet comfortable service (and most incredible risotto) I have ever had at a restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Lynniepest
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two night stay at the Eden Hotel and all I can say is WOW. The staff welcomed us warmly and although totally professional they were not at all stuffy. We had a standard room which was very comfortable and spotless. The view across Rome at breakfast was beautiful as was the breakfast itself. I cannot fault this hotel and would love to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Yvan M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Rome for a short break and really enjoyed staying in the Hotel Eden. Our room with balcony over the city was very comfortable and the bathroom was very large and luxurious too (marble everywhere). Breakfast was served in the restaurant which has a fantastic panoramic view over Rome and staff was very efficient and discrete. The concierge gave us great advice on museums and restaurants and the Rooms Division Manager, Mr. Pietro Zanzot took care of ervery little detail during our stay. Thank you to all staff for this wonderful experience,

Reviews.Title: “the eden. really!”
Reviews.Author: francois b
Reviews.Content: Tried this hotel few weeks ago after beeing in other 5 stars hotels in Rome in the past.... What a surprise! best staff, warm and professional! the location is fantastic, only 5 minutes from the spanish steps and 2 minutes from via veneto and still in a very quiet position. restaurant La Terazza ,as well as the Bar on the 6th floor, is amaziong...breathetaking views over the ethernal city. ...I guess i have finally fund my Hotel in Rome for the future Grazies

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel and it's location”
Reviews.Author: Tappi88
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel is absolutely wonderful. After arriving from a 4 night stay at the snooty Le Sirenuse in Positano, we were overjoyed with our stay at the Eden. From the moment we walked into our room (That was upgraded through our Leading Hotels reservation), we knew we found a hotel we would enjoy. The room was beautifully decorated with various Rome artwork. We had some friends staying in a different room, completely decorated in a different, modern fashion, that made us want to see further room designs. The rooftop is a great place for lunch or just to grab a drink. When we ordered an espresso martini, Walter the bartender came over to our table to ask how we liked it and what improvements he could make, as he had never made one before. We recommended that he shake all of the ingredients together to make the "froth". 10 minutes later he arrived at our table with two incredibly frothy martinis. It is nice to see someone take pride in their work. The business center is incredibly easy to use, no codes or passwords like other hotels. The exercise room is small, but open 24 hours. There are individual televisions on each treadmill, so bring your ear buds. The hotel is a few minute walk to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, high end shops and many restaurants. I would recommend a taxi for trips to the Coliseum and the Vatican. Our next trip to Rome will be sure to include the Eden

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff, nice rooms, bellisimo”
Reviews.Author: chateaupro
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Eden for 9 nights in 2010. The staff was outstanding, welcoming and warm. The location is exceptional, the room very nice. The entire stay was great. Only issue was the rooftop restaurant where I had dinner the night before departure ... very mediocre food with prices in the statosphere....otherwise a flawless stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Wonderful Staff EXCEPT FOR ONE MGR”
Reviews.Author: dgaribaldidpm
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 2week stay in Europe & spent the last 3 days in Rome. I had returned to Rome for my ancestors 150 th year celebration on the UNIFICATION of Italy. We were picked up at the airport by a very professional & informative Limo driver. The 85 euros were worth it. (Although I wasn't informed of the charge until check out.) The Hotel Eden is a stunning facility with very ornate & elaborate furnishings. One will feel like royalty upon entering the Hotel Eden. That quickly ends when you meet the early daytime mgr. I had politely requested if there was an upgrade available for Starwood Gold Members? Loudly he broadcasted that since we were staying at the Hotel Eden using our Starwood Points, that an upgrade was not possible. It was both embarassing & degrading to make such an announcement. It was obvious by the look of his female assistants desk agent that she was also embarassed by his reply. I understand that other hotel guest pay for rooms, but so have I many many times before. There should be no preferential treatment for someone who is paying with the Euro or with points. Upon check out, the same mgr was at the desk that am. We requested if there was transportation to the Sheraton Roma where we schedule to stay close to the airport because of an early flight. He claimed they were not affiliated with the Sheraton. Both the Hotel Eden & Sheraton Roma are UNDER STARWOOD PROPERTIES...he failed to give us any information about transportation. It wasn't until we returned later that day to pick up our luggage, that the evening mgr (total opposite of the early mgr), politely informed us that we had missed our transportation & was apologetic for his associates behavior. I would recommend having a cocktail or dinner on the rooftop or sit at the bar & ask for Walter. Walter the bar mgr is the utmost in hospitality & professionalism. So my overall review is great place, wonderful staff, just stay away from the short, pretentious, bald, with glasses daytime mgr. Ciao Senor Garibaldi

Reviews.Title: “What a treat!”
Reviews.Author: SLPCHI
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome after 3 days in Venice. After the train ride and the long line for a taxi, we just wanted a place to re-group before heading to Spain. What we got was beyond our expectations. We were given an upgrade - which turned out to be a lovely suite! The location is great: about a 5 minute walk to the top of the Spanish steps. The staff is courteous and helpful. There is also a business center with 2 computers and printers - no additional charge. Whatever you do, don't miss breakfast. The view from the sixth floor dining room is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Live Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Flipendo
Reviews.Content: If you are searching for Paradise and you arrive in Rome, there is one way for your dream to become true: Eden Hotel. Rome is a city of history and miracle and this hotel has them both. A history, since 1889, and a miracle, given by it's location (very close to Spanish Steps), it's class, it's rooms, it's services and it's food. Bref, Eden is in the middle of Rome, so you are close to the city center. Rooms are fantastic: spacious, high, with fantastic furniture and very well equipped. Service is perfect: you will be pamperized and, bonus, you will receive a bottle of red wine with compliments from the manager. Food - up to 6th floor, where Rome will be at your feet with a sensational panorama. Is not cheap, but it worths every euro.

Reviews.Title: “my first choice in rome”
Reviews.Author: newyorker020
Reviews.Content: this was my second stay at hotel eden and it was as good as the first. the hotel is just a few minutes walk from spanish steps. while it is close to all the action and the best shopping it has a very peaceful feeling about it. my room was small but the most charming small room i have ever slept in. the sheets are linen. the hotel is immaculate. the view from the restaurant is amazing. the staff is helpful and friendly while service is strictly white glove. i would move in to this hotel. femme sistina hair salon right down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Leslye321
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (2 parents and 2 grown children) stayed at the Hotel Eden for 2 nights while seeing Rome. We had 2 rooms on the same floor. We chose this hotel for its location and also for its ambiance. The location was close to the Borghese Gardens for walking, jogging and sightseeing purposes and it was also 10 minutes from the Spanish Steps. We had looked into the Hassler Hotel (at the top of the Spanish Steps), but it was not as pretty, was crowded with tourists and was more expensive. The staff at the Eden was so helpful! The rooms were beautifully decorated, the lobby was exquisite and as I said, the location is perfect. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Bellissimo!! What staying in a Roman hotel should be!!”
Reviews.Author: denatlanta
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel! The hotel manager and front desk staff were professional, friendly, and helpful! Beautiful lobby and sitting area! Our room, on the top floor, was the most beautiful room we have ever stayed in with an all marble bathroom, walk in shower, large closet, comfortable bed, and stunning views!! We found this hotel by accident, happened to be walking by, went in, talked to the wonderful staff, and booked a room for when we returned from our cruise! No regrets at all and we will stay here again on our next visit to Roma, the most beautiful city in the world! Dennis Ferioli Mark Rinder

Reviews.Title: “Travel Agent Review: Nicest Hotel I Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: caribe_chic
Reviews.Content: I was completely blown away by this place. The lobby and sitting area is gorgeous, with elegant marble and furnishings. The front desk staff were incredibly helpful and kind. There is a concierge available to call taxis, provide directions, and offer recommendations for eateries and things to do. We were in a room on the 3rd floor with a gorgeous marble bathroom and great tub/shower combination. The room itself was huge in comparison to other hotels in the area. The ceilings had to be close to 15 feet high with a chandelier and 2 windows. Once with a view of the courtyard area and the other with a view of the park and University across the street. It was a stunning view. I was fortunate enough to get a tour of the hotel from the sales manager, Stefano. He was so kind and gave me a great deal of information about the hotel. I was able to see the penthouse suite, a few studio suites, and a three level suite. Almost all suites connect to a double deluxe room, which is excellent for people traveling in groups or for parents who was a bit of luxury with the kids nearby. I also toured the upstairs restaurant which is renowned as a great place to dine with spectacular views. It certainly did not fall short on the views aspect. On the 6th floor of the hotel and with no obstructions around it, you can see over Rome for a few miles in all directions. We only had a day in Rome before our flight back to NY, so we wanted to see all we could in the Vatican. It is a short walk from the Spanish Steps (and the Metro Stop-Spagna), which we used to get around for the day. It was a very hot day, and after about 6 hours of touring, we returned to the hotel to find a complimentary bottle of red wine waiting for us. It was a very nice gesture, but we were so tired and dehydrated that drinking wine probably would not have been the greatest idea. Plus, we had just come off a 12 day Mediterranean cruise, so I think my liver had all it could take at that point :). There is a turndown service in which you are given a pair of slippers. This might have been the best part: it was a small touch that made a real difference after walking around in Rome all day and night. I recommend this hotel to everyone. Yes, it can be a bit pricey, the restaurant especially, but they say you get what you pay for, and I really believe this place was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, absolutely outstanding staff!”
Reviews.Author: Jesse S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed on our honeymoon trip. Overall, the hotel was a great place to stay with all the conveniences you would expect. Rooms -- Spacious room - we stayed in #511 on the 5th floor (side note - do NOT stay in #511 - it is right under the restaurant kitchen and we could not sleep a wink - noise until 2am and then again at 530am) -- more on this later. We got moved to #505 which was wonderful - spacious, clean, comfortable, great views and very quiet! Staff -- The staff is absolutely incredible. Every request was honored. When we had difficulty sleeping in room #511, Consuela, the front desk manager, promptly moved our room to #505, made sure that we did not pay for the one night that was noisy and even sent up a nice bottle of Champagne (in addition to the free bottle of wine they had already put in our room upon arrival). She performed all of this with an extremely understanding and positive attitude. The efforts they put forth to rectify the issue were much appreciated. You can be sure that you will get what you are expecting, or else the staff at the Eden will make it right. Location -- We took cabs nearly everywhere from here for convenience. It was never more than about 10 Euros to any location. The staff was very good at calling the cab so that it would be there by the time we got downstairs, every single time. Business services -- The have wireless internet throughout that works great. It is 15 Euros for 24 consecutive hours. Restaurant/bar - Nice location on the rooftop. Drinks were expensive at 19 Euros for average martinis. But that's the price to pay for the view and location. Live pianist did a nice job at night. Gym - Available and clean. Overall, a historic hotel, tons of history. Very classy decor throughout and spacious, comfortable rooms. Staff is outstanding. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A superb hotel with excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: LilyK11
Reviews.Content: Hotel Eden is simply a wonderful hotel where every staff cares about their guests’ comfort and enjoyment at their property. The front-desk team tries very best to accommodate your request and to do beyond your original reservation requirement if possible. As a Starwood Gold member, we were upgraded to a large room with Villa Borghese view and a plenty of closet and storage space. The concierges were always helpful and knowledgeable about everything, patiently teaching us how to ride Eurostar train in Italy (we had never ridden train before). Our room was very quiet due to the long and large hallway from the entry door to the bedroom and the windows and the shutters are newly installed and there was no noise from outside – oh, you can still hear church bell ringing, which was very lovely. The room and bathroom were well kept and super clean. The turndown service was excellent as everything else. The morning breakfast was included in our hotel package but it was well worth the price considering variety of food and quality they serve and absolutely panoramic view of Rome. I think their croissants (plain kind) was the best in Rome! The service was so attentive and one server noticed that I was a foodie and introduced me the Italian way of eating incredibly delectable buffalo ricotta cheese and a few other things. In addition, I had an opportunity to find out how deeply General Manager, Mr. Marcel Levy get involved with even a minor guest relationship issues. That was beyond my expectation! It was a great pleasure to stay at this lovely property and other guests we met at the hotel told us their wonderful experience. We both agreed that we would be back to Eden at our next visit in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NEohiotraveler
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We knew we had a week off for vacation but we could not decide where to go - next thing I know - my husband finds two business class tickets for Rome with points. With only a day and a half notice, American Express suggested this hotel among others. We are so glad we went with this choice for a number of reasons. I loved the location and how easy it was to get everywhere. We walked to Bernini plaza, Trevi Fountain, Spanish steps the gardens. . . everywhere. Most of all, the concierge helped us with private tours, train tickets, dinner and each time a welcoming attitude. Be sure to have an evening cocktail overlooking Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: woldtraveller7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on a quiet street just off the Via De Veneto. The staff are all super courteous and the concierges are keen to assist with excursion and meal bookings. We had 2 double deluxe rooms on the fifth floor. They are perfectly OK but not standout by any means. If we came again the rooms to have are the "double deluxe rooms with a view" again on the fifth floor because I have to say that the views from the top floors of this hotel are fantastic. The restaurant and bar are the real selling points for this hotel. They are both on the sixth floor and provide the most amazing panoramic views of the city - absolutely breathtaking. The food in the main restaurant "La Terraza" was of an excellent standard but expect to pay over 100 euros per person for the a la carte menu (excluding wine).

Reviews.Title: “Best Rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeffnwoody
Reviews.Content: The Eden is just great, The rooms are very nice, large and clean. The location is perfect. The staff is excellent, The size of the hotel is very nice, feels like a boutique hotel. I have stayed in most of the nice 5 star hotels in Rome and this is where I will come back for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, helpful and friendly staff...and FANTASTIC view from room!”
Reviews.Author: rsoltes
Reviews.Content: We were looking to switch our hotel at last minute during our trip to Rome and we were hoping for something with a view of the Villa Borghese.The staff at the Eden Hotel was EXTREMELY friendly and helpful...and the women even let us choose which of the two available rooms we liked best. The room itself was great...clean, wonderful bed...and (most importantly) with a wonderful view overlooking the Villa Borghese. We stood on the balcony and drank wine for the last three days of our trip. The Eden Hotel saved our trip to Rome and made it a wonderful experience! It is definitely not cheap, but is comprable to the hotels in that particular area (in price). I would DEFINITELY recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: Gabrielle1271
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel twice so far. It is an amazing hotel, beautiful and elegant. It has a perfect position in Rome, making easy any trips around the Rome downtown. Food is also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “My family like it very much and we will surely come back again!”
Reviews.Author: Ilya_Fitisov
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank the Hotel Eden Roma for the perfect time We’ve had from 10th to 12th of July 2011. The Hotel Staff is very attentive, very polite and doing all their best and even more to serve guests in the best way. We could only dream about the room we had during our stay with Eden Roma. The room is very elegantly decorated with carefully chosen furniture and fabrics in warm light colours. The view that we had outside the room was fantastic. We feel we are in the Heart of the Universe. We will live and think about coming back to Hotel Eden Roma. Thanks for the great Holiday we had during our stay. We plan to be with Hotel Eden Roma in August this year and we hope that every time and detail we will have during our stay is going to be perfect. I wish to the Hotel Eden Roma prosperity and be the first among the Best Hotels in the World giving its guest unforgettable and great stay with you. Mrs Inna Chizhenko.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Hotel Lives Up to Its Rating”
Reviews.Author: cccarol
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. The room we had, which was upgraded, was probably the nicest hotel room in which I've ever stayed. This is a 5 star hotel, so you get the 5 star elegance, glamour and prices. The check in desk attendant showed us to our room personally. Our room had two watercolors on the wall by a world famous 19th century English painter of masterpieces. The room was absolutely lovely, overlooking a nearby private villa/park area. It was large, with a spacious bathroom outfitted in marble floors, walls and counters. The hotel lavishes amenities on its guests. The hotel is near the Spanish Steps, a convenient walk. American Embassy is in walking distance, as is the Trevi Fountain and Veneto shopping area. I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. The concierges were most helpful. There is free internet/computer access in the business center. We went up to the highly acclaimed rooftop bar and had wonderful cocktails and appetizers. The bartender knows his stuff and mixed perfect martinis, daquiris and whiskey sours. My compliments to him! The bar provides complimentary small h'ors d'oeuvres. We ordered a large appetizer or two to share, and we were so full, we didn't eat dinner! So consider having drinks/appetizers in the bar. The drink prices are high, but it's worth the experience and million dollar view of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the most beautiful city on earth”
Reviews.Author: maccc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on Sept, 2010. It is a very nice property with nice, spacious, clean rooms. The only minor issue would be location. It is pretty far from most tourist areas. The staff are very friendly and breakfast was excellent. They even gave us complimentary champange because we were on our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Marvelous”
Reviews.Author: fortlove
Reviews.Content: We used points and didnt get upgraded but the room was so nice it didn't matter. Loved the location - close to a lot for walking or public transit internet is spotty - but have free servicein business center with freeprinting etc

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel In Rome”
Reviews.Author: Richmond-VA-Barb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eden for four nights at the end of June. This hotel is part of the Starwood family of hotels – but you would never know it. This smaller hotel (121 rooms) is anything but pedestrian. From the moment we walked in the door we were pampered and treated like long time friends. Every detail is thought out and planned down to the cloth they put slippers on beside the bed each night. Each room (we had three different rooms) is uniquely decorated and furnished – nothing feels prescribed. They did not hesitate when accommodating our request to have our rooms located close together by upgrading one of the rooms. The service hits just the right note – available but not intrusive. This is especially true in the terrace bar and restaurant. We went for drinks several evenings as well as for dinner for one evening. You cannot top this restaurant for its views of Rome - particularly at sunset…magnifico. The food both in presentation and flavor live up to expensive price tag. This hotel is located close to exclusive shopping as well as the Spanish Steps. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Noise_Natzi
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here in May 2011. Check in was fast and friendly. We actually arrived early in the morning and they had our room ready early for us which was lovely. Our room was very very spacious. There was a little hall area which led into a very luxurious appointed bedroom with a small lounge area and a separate walk in wardrobe and huge marble bathroom. There were only a few little things which were not so great, the sheets felt like a rough stiff tablecloth. Bed was comfortable though. The hotel was very very loud. There were constant loud bangs from doors being slammed by other guests which echoed through the hall ways. If there was better sound proofing, this hotel would be up there with one of my favourites.

Reviews.Title: “Great View - Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: Heidi-n-Sunil
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in May of 09. First stop after a trans-atlantic. Actually got a pretty sweet deal after a price match - ~ 250 EUR a night (spg.com will price match any other site). Ok.. keep in mind this is Rome. The front desk was friendly, we were escorted to our room, I had requested a room with a view (I suppose everyone does), but we got a great view of the old city outside our balcony - and the attendant pointed out that she had noted the request in the reservation. Didn't have an opportunity to try out the restaurant. Room size was fine by European standards. All the cabs knew the hotel. Bell staff was friendly. Had one of the upper floors - was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous, friendly, and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: whittaker94
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly, helpful and courteous in all areas of the hotel. Always helps to contribute to an enjoyable visit. I stayed 8 nights. Outstanding panoramic views across the whole of Rome from the restaurant/bar area on the top floor. Good breakfasts and restaurant food.Excellent friendly and discreet bar staff. Attractive bathroom and walk-in wadrobe area. I was probably in a mid-range room. It was comfortable overlooking the front second/third floor. Nice prints on the walls. 6/7 mins to the nearest underground and similar to Spanish steps. Can reach all areas of Rome fairly easily and all the trendy shopping areas nearby. As in all hotels would like access to my own small fridge and tea/coffee making facilities. But I realize they rely on room service as do the Eden. Its an expensive hotel but still retains some charm and character and is relatively quiet and low key. I will visit again

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: bodus
Reviews.Content: The terrace is gorgeous, the hotel simply fantastic, price too high but it is Rome. Every room is different with a lot of charm. The restaurant... simply too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel Experience of my Life”
Reviews.Author: PammyLee
Reviews.Content: The first room that I was given at The Eden Hotel already had someone in it. After a quick exit I was taken to a dark, small room with no carpet and no working outlets. The sheets on the bed were like burlap which did not make me happy as I was being charged 422 Euros a night. I asked for another room and was shown one even smaller . I finally was taken to a third room which was adequate but it still had the rough sheets. I ordered a chicken and vegetable sandwich from room service which turned out to be a tiny piece of chicken with a hunk of zucchini on a small roll which cost 23 Euros! That night I woke up and felt some kind of bug crawling on me and it turned out ants were all over the bed and in my suitcase.. The staff at the front desk were not helpful. Never stay at The Eden Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Eden made our 30th wedding anniversary one we will never forget”
Reviews.Author: joannferr
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Eden is a fantastic hotel, centrally located in the center of Romes most famous attractions. We were greeted and treated like we were the most important vistors that had ever been guests at the hotel. The consierges were exceptional, Fabio and Bernardo, both went above and beyond with their reccomendations. At one point, they actually came running down the street after us when they learned of changes to our tour! Our room was beautiful and had a small balcony that overlooked the Vatican City. It was a lovely addition. The room was spotless and spaceous. The resturant breakfasts were the best that we had during our 10 day vacation in Italy. On our anniversary we had a romantic dinner at the la Terraza resturant. With the beautiful views, wonderful menu, and excellent service, it was a night that we will cherish for many years to come. I can not say a bad thing about Hotel Eden. I will reccomend it to friends and make it my hotel of choice when we visit Rome in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money.”
Reviews.Author: Rummy123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking forward to spending a few days in Rome after completing a cruise. We had researched hotels looking for someplace special, centrally located, lots of amenities, and a great reputation for service and comfort. We thought Hotel Eden would fit the bill. What a disappointment. Ok, there was a doorman to greet us, someone escorted us to our room, probably because it was located around so many corridors away from the elevator, they figured we'd NEVER find it. The room was lovely, but very noisy. Our room was in an uncarpeted hall area and heavy doors from other guest rooms were always closing 'hard and noisily". Thought we'd have to ask for a different room, but eventually it quieted down late in evening. After returning from dinner figured there was no turn down service since room was exactly as we had left it, so we started to get ready for bed....then someone starts ringing our door asking us, at perhaps 8:30, if WE want HER to prepare the room. Hmmm, a little late. Hotel staff not particularly friendly, upon arrival we were never told of food credits we were given (that way we could enjoy a complete breakfast) so we thought we were only entitled to a "continental breakfast at 33 Euros each" consisting of few croissants and coffee while a nice breakfast buffet was available just behind us. Finally, since we were sooo hungry, we asked how much breakfast was, only then did they "check" to see of we could have breakfast with our room price (which was rediculously expensive), which it WAS!! Next day, stiff, awkward servers showed us to a table where there was a total LACK of service. Someone brought over coffee, never offered juice, never came back to refill coffee or ask if there was anything we needed. We were on our own. Second night asked concierge to make dinner recommendations and reservations for us. He called a cab for us only to realize (once we were on the way) that the driver had NO idea where this place was (concierge should have given him (and us) a written name and address of this restaurant) So he drove around, couldn't understand or speak English with us, and just pointed for us to go down some alley to find it somewhere over there...We had to call concierge several times to try to talk to the cab driver, and us for additional directions. No help. Never did find this restaurant, never got apology from concierge. Wished we could have dropped bread crumbs along a path, would have helped us find our way back to the hotel. Not a good feeling to dropped off in a unfamiliar city after asking for assistance from the concierge to find a nice restaurant for dinner. Don't waste your money at this hotel. It's WAY too expensive and there are LOTS of elegant, less expensive and friendlier hotels in the area. It's defintiely NOT worth it. Very sad and disappointing for us as we had such high hopes for a fantastic welcoming stay at Hotel Eden. Suggestion to the staff: Start offering the "fussed over" attention to your "regular guests" as you do for your "high profile guests" you feature on your hotel video clip shown in each room.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: lck88
Reviews.Content: I picked Hotel Eden because it was a Starwood property and was 5 stars so I knew it would be a nice quality. I must have gotten a screaming deal at 297 euros per night per room because the hotel definitely seemed much more expensive (and yes, I do think 297 euros at 1.5 exchange rate IS expensive anyway). THe place was elegant, but the staff was snooty. When I inqired if my rate included a breakfast, as it had at the other two hotels that I had booked, I was told no. Okay, how much could breakfast be??? 53 EUROS per person I was told! WOW, Never did I think that I would be asked to pay 1/3 of my room price based on double occupancy for breakfast! I had specifically chosen a hotel with a restaurant because we were staying over on Good Friday and leaving Easter morning. Ooops! I was surprised that there was not even complementary coffee or juices in the lobby. The room was small but plush but the hairdryer was hardwired through the room desk! Not convenient for me to be getting ready while my husband was still sleeping! The other reviews are correct in that it is a fabulous location, but even still, I will not be staying there again. I like to feel welcome in a hotel, not like I have no business being there because I'm not dressed in my St John Knits that I left at home!

Reviews.Title: “hotel Eden beautiful holiday”
Reviews.Author: mariabondi68
Reviews.Content: We used Romeairporttransportation during our trip to Rome three weeks ago .. I used them for Airport pick up and the service was great. The driver (Marcello) was waiting for us and we had a great tour of the city. Then we were escorted to our hotel Eden.
