(and truly elegant hotel with all the comforts, situated in the center of the city) During our stay I was in contact with them, all together, were very sensitive and kind. We booked tour in Florence. The accommodation is very nice Overall, great service and a great attitude. Thank you, thank you for recommended Romeairporttransportation Hotel Eden. I'll take your service next time ..... by Maria

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Nice Extras”
Reviews.Author: Bingo58
Reviews.Content: Never having been to Rome before we were at a bit of a loss as to where in the city we wanted to stay. We had many sites that were on our don't-miss list, and the Eden fit our needs for a number of reasons. The taxi to the hotel was a bit nerve-racking once we entered the city proper. After the overnight flight we were ready to relax in the hotel a bit. The taxi is €40 as a standard fee (within the walls) but he got us to our hotel with good cheer (he was patient with my Italian) and was quite proud of his city. The hotel is lovely when you enter after a very pleasant greeting from the door staff. There are a couple of attractive rooms right off the lobby to sit and read or relax for a bit. The front desk staff was efficient and helpful; much more formal, too, than the staffs at our subsequent hotels in Florence and Venice. They were ceaselessly helpful which we much appreciated. Our room was lovely with high ceilings, a nicely situated desk, plenty of closet and drawer space, and a very comfortable bed. The only drawback was the heat - the room was uncomfortably warm and the air conditioner controls did not seem to help matters. We often slept with the windows open, pulling the lovely and extravagant drapes off to the side and opening the shutters. The bathroom, with a bidet, was large and spotlessly clean at all times. There was a long two-sink counter, with nice toiletries and plenty of towels. The tub was high, making getting in and out of the shower a bit tricky. Make sure you're holding onto something! Good water pressure, which is always welcome. The towel warming racks were helpful, too, as it poured rain while we were there and they helped to dry socks and shirts. The Terrace on the 6th floor has marvelous views of St Peter's and Rome down to the Tiber. It was a treat each day to start with coffee and to be greeted so warmly (there is full breakfast service and a buffet that was quite attractive, too). I popped my head in one evening to see an elegant crowd enjoying the jazz combo in the bar. I meant to return but was always too tired from sightseeing. The Eden has a nice location - the Spanish Steps are five minutes away, and the Via Veneto is up at the end of the Via Ludovisi. The hotel is also near the Villa Borghese, home of the exquisite Galleria Borghese, a must see. A nice amenity that many hotels could and should follow is the free Internet access in the business center. Ask at the desk and you will get a username and password for unlimited time online (others may be waiting, though). I loved this feature and, all things being equal, would be the reason I return to the Eden before trying another hotel. A good choice, though it is expensive. Its location means you can walk to many sites and it is near a number of transportation hubs for farther destinations. We couldn't have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely 5 Star Hotel excellently located”
Reviews.Author: DiscriminatingNY'er
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, well located hotel between the Spanish Steps and the Via Veneto. Frankly, I'd be hard pressed to suggest the Eden is significantly better than any of its half dozen 5 star competitors in the near vicinity, however, if you are inclined towards a smaller, "boutique" type hotel, then this should fit your preferences. There's a great deal of personal attention paid to guests due to the relatively smaller size of the number of guestrooms. By no means is this a small hotel (120 rooms), but its size does help manage to avoid some of the "hotel mill" of many of its larger sized competitors. We're a 3 person family, and the Eden offered one of the best deals on a junior suite that would accommodate us (about $600/n). Our 2 room suite was on the third floor overlooking much of the city to the south and east. The included breakfast buffet is on the top floor with gorgeous expansive views of the city. Meals/cocktails there were memorable! Staff was extremely attentive, helpful and personable. Simply a lovely, charming, well managed top notch hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Honda21
Reviews.Content: Well positioned hotel and some rooms have great views over St Peters. The Restaurant is expensive but the views make it a memorable experience. The staff are great with a fine work ethic.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Eden - Excellence and Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Piero061
Reviews.Content: Hotel Eden restored my faith in the values of excellent customer service and 5 Star Plus quality in every hotel rating category. From the morning we arrived after several hours delay dealing with luggage left behind in Heathrow, we felt like well cared for guests in someone's private home at this lovely boutique hotel. Because of our Starwood Gold & Platinun status the hotel upgraded us, my husband and I and my daughter and neice respectively. Our room though small but normal by European standards, had a To Die For view of St. Peter's and the city. My daughter was given a lst floor corner room of huge proportions with an equally gigantic beautifully marbeled bathroom fit for a queen! During our 6 day stay everyone we encountered whether in the hallways, elevators, terrace lounge or dining room had a friendly greeting for us. The superb concierge staff and front desk staff at The Eden are the most helpful and gracious I have ever encountered in a European Hotel. But then, The Eden is less like a hotel and more like a home away from home. If you want to feel like royalty choose The Eden. The Eden once served some of the royalty of Europe in its early years, as I learned from reading a lovely little book in my room which told the history of this special gem of a hotel. I have to say a few more words about the concierge staff all of whom showed us genuine hospitality in looking after every detail of our stay whether they were planning our a visit to the Galleria Borghese or suggesting an excellent restaurant or trattoria known better to locals than tourists. The front desk staff and Mr. Levy the general manager, impressed us even further by remembering my husband's birthday with a delicious bottle of wine which we enjoyed from our balcony overlooking gorgeous Rome in the early evening. Rome is now a place I feel at home and almost intimate with, all because of The Eden.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaszboy2000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top-notch, me and my girlfriend enjoyed it a lot. The lobby is really nice, the hotel gives a nice warm and cosy victorian feel. The service is really good and all the staff are really nice, they're always happy to help. The hotel is very close to the spanish steps, if you need any help with directions then just as someone at reception and they will all be happy to help (and they also give you a map). Our room was great, we always had the room warm and it was cleaned quite regularly, the only small problem were the sheets and covers of the bed, I felt they were really rough on the skin but apart from that everything was great. There are many cool cafe's just outside and shops too so I recommend having break fast and lunch over there because the hotel restaurant is not cheap, although i advise you it once because the food is good and the view from the window is even better.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: txj151
Reviews.Content: coul walk everywhere. it was amazing. great service, beautiful room and comfy

Reviews.Title: “Certainly one of the hotels with the best service in Europe”
Reviews.Author: monte2204
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Eden for a Valentine's treat including opera etc. The hotel staff, especially concierge and reception, were going out of their way to make the stay unforgettable. Truly unique service, certainly one of the best ever experienced on the continent. Room service was super quick and efficient. Restaurant on top floor was amazing - great food and wine list, tremendous views. Room was unexpectedly spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby Needs Serious Updating”
Reviews.Author: frequent-travler22
Reviews.Content: I have stayed many times in the past at the Hotel Eden. The hotel is now part of the Starwood Group and as they are doing throughout Europe, they buy very famous hotels and then do not invest in them. This is what they have done with the Eden. What used to be a grand hotel in an excellent location with stunning views has now become a shabby hotel that is over priced. Carpets in the room are not good quality. The bathroom drain smelled of sewage. Room needed painting. The breakfast, which was 35 euros, very average quality. The beautiful breakfast room which was stunning now has wicker chairs to sit on. WiFi only works in the lobby and that costs 15 Euros a day. Service was excellent and the manager certainly responded to my complaints and offered me a new room. There are many hotels in Rome that offer a much better alternative especially for the price. I really would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Used”
Reviews.Author: russy177
Reviews.Content: Booked a Deluxe Room which was 300 euro per nite. On arrival got upgraded to a suite with two rooms, which according to the LHW website cost 1000 euro per nite , i cannot imagine my feelings if i would have paid 1000 euro and got this !!!! P.S See for your self , 1000 euro suite!!! ( PHOTOS)

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent information from Staff”
Reviews.Author: mcathleen
Reviews.Content: We hven't ctually been to this hotel yet but already have an issue. We are scheduled to stay theer in May, 2011. When booking (a non-refundable) roo we were told our room would have a balcony with a view. We then went on to another hote staff member to finalize our reservation, however, when this reservation was compete...this staff member told us our room DID NOT necessarily come with a balcony/view. This is the whole reason we chose this property over the Westin Excelsior...its spectacular views. Now we are being told a balcony view from our room cannot be confirmed till check-in. Thanks for having staff who give you mis-information. We may not have booked here had we not thought we'd have a room with a view...but now they "have" us, as our reservation is classed as no-refundable. Very disappointed and we have not even arrived yet.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service at an elegant yet comfortable small hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dpnyc
Reviews.Content: Concierge, front desk staff, restaurant staff (we only ate breakfast), and housekeeping were all exceptionally helpful and knowledgeable. We ate exclusively at restaurants suggested by the concierge and all but one were outstanding, local, not too fussy places without tons of tourists (one was a bit overpriced and touristy, although the food was good). The room was small but comfortable and lovely in a traditional style. We stayed through Amex platinum's 3 nights for the price of 2 rate, which helped make this a better value. It is definitely an expensive property, but comparable to its peer hotels in Rome. Our rate included breakfast which was excellent, but pricey on its own. The restaurant and bar area has a most special view. Only complaint is that the sheets were surprisingly very very scratchy, as though they were overstarched. Very strange! Also agree with another reviewer that the fee for internet access in the business center is rather absurd in a hotel of this calibre. But we would stay at the Eden again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A welcoming haven in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: connell66
Reviews.Content: As you are greeted by the doorman, you know you have arrived at a special hotel. The staff inside greet you with warmth and charm and the lobby and lounge beyond are bright and inviting. Our room was lovely and spacious and we had an equally large and luxurious old-fashioned marble bathroom. Breakfast is taken in the top floor restaurant and bar area with breathtaking views of the city. This is a truly lovely hotel and well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it”
Reviews.Author: Nissenbaum_j
Reviews.Content: Great location. rooms classically elegant but small. V nice concierge,( my wife had sudden urgent dental problem, they found us a dentist on holiday weekend) great dinner recommendations. Annoying to pay for Internet Restaraunt prohibitively expensive.

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bellagio2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and loved every moment. The staff (doormen, concierge, front desk) were very friendly and went the extra mile to be of service. Our Deluxe room was very tastefully decorated, and faced a courtyard so was very peaceful (absolutely no street noise). The hotel has the usual quality features you'd expect (modern gym, beautiful foyer) that you'd expect. We had a fantastic dinner at the restaurant upstairs which has a stunning view over Rome. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant European Luxury”
Reviews.Author: 4MGOBLUE
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Eden is an elegant hotel with wondrous views and a perfect location, but the staff is what puts it at the top of it's class. From check-in to concierge to waitstaff, the Eden excelled in every area. They made our anniversary trip to Italy memorable. Starting every day in the rooftop restaurant with 360 views of the city was amazing. They take care of every detail and are warm, friendly and courteous. Five stars from this reviewer.

Reviews.Title: “A dissapointng Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alain-london72
Reviews.Content: I was expecting much better from this Hotel, 1 I did not find the room or the Bathroom very nice in my junior suite. Room did not have much character with limited furniture and a tv the size of a laptop screen. 2 no wifi anywhre but in Lobby 3 no spa in hotel 4 breakfast buffet last call at 10:20 am while we were eating The only plus I woud give is the Bar on the top floor, besides that it was very dissapointing for a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars...and it's not enough”
Reviews.Author: herethere79
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times over the past 10 years, and have found it to consistently be one of my favorite world-wide. The service is always efficient, courteous, and welcoming, the hotel quiet, beautiful and luxurios without the sense of snobbishness. Wonderful terrace bar & restaurant with excellent quality

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Craggy40
Reviews.Content: I was taken here by my partner and friends for a 40th birthday present. The hotel was lovely and staff helpful as our Italian is not strong. The rooms were well appointed and clean, but exactly what would be expected. The mini-bar and offered snacks in the room were prohibitably expensive, so we did not partake. The rooftop bar/restaurant were small but well appointed if not very over priced. Enjoyable break and hotel delivered what was expected!

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jimmy1199
Reviews.Content: we had heard great things about this hotel from AmEx platinum and friends who stayed there years ago, but had a bad experience. we disliked our first room, were treated rudely about changing rooms, were expected to handle the broken internet on our own, and got poor service from the concierge regarding a restaurant suggestion. I never write a review except to gush about a wonderful experience, but felt compelled to express my dissatisfaction with hotel eden. It was one problem after another, and the only disappointment in an otherwise wonderful holiday.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: philaMD
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eden for 4 nights at the end of Sept. Overall we had a very positive experience. The room was lovely and spacious, the bathroom luxurious, and the staff extremely friendly.We asked the concierge desk for help and info on a couple of occasions and they tried to be helpful. Unfortunately they gave us slightly incorrect info, but it was not a problem.We used points to pay for most of the stay, so only actually paid (50%) 1 night.The hotel is very expensive if you are paying full price. It's location near the Via Veneto and the Borghese Gallery was a real plus,but it is far away from a lot of Rome, and taxis are very(!) expensive. The metro is a 10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: mindygor
Reviews.Content: After reading a number of negative reviews of the Hotel Eden, we were somewhat reluctant to stay here. I had accumulated many Starwood Points to get a suite for 3 nights. We were pleasantly surprised by the location, the hotel ammeneties, the friendliness of the staff and our beautiful and spacious suite. It is located in a residential neighborhood, a 10 minute walk to the Spanish Steps. Because of this location we did take many taxis. We only had a light lunch in the restaurant when we arrived. The prices in the restaurant were absolutely outragous. Therefore, we chose to eat all of our other meals outside of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended Friendly and Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: BrianRI
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Eden for 5 nights. The staff, especially the concierge services, were friendly and accomodating to a tee. Beautiful propery in a very nice location close to Spanish Steps, shopping and many good restaurants. Our room, a small suite, was very nicely appointed, in perfect condition with a nice bath. I don't see how anyone could go wrong with this hotel. Moderately expensive as you'd expect from a small luxury hotel, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: sammied1025
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently traveled to Rome where we stayed at the Eden Hotel for three nights. We were greeted warmly by the hotel staff and the accommodations, while nothing stellar, was as expected. Both the sleeping area and bathroom were clean. We spent one night enjoying the views from the bar and the location was excellent for walking around the city. Our overall experience at the hotel was good. A con: our room was situated towards the street and a lot of vehicle noise came through in the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LsGtsCA
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the first week of August after a 12 day cruise. I was hoping for a view but got an inside room. The peace and quiet turned out to be perfect after the new-port-every-day pace of the cruise. Marble bathrooms reminiscent of the Danieli. Desk staff was eager to please, lobby staff was courteous. We were prepared by Trip Advisor for the food prices, a but a block away there were restaurants and osterias on every block. Prices comparable to CA Bay Area but the food and the enthusiasm of restaurant owners the was beyond comparison. One night we got a silver bowl full of biscotti complements of the house. It was only two blocks to the top of the Spanish steps. One complaint, we asked for a wake up call the morning we left and didn't get it. Eden will be my first choice - as long as I have Starwood points. Maybe even id I don't. LsGts, CA

Reviews.Title: “Give It a Miss”
Reviews.Author: napmurphy
Reviews.Content: 10 years ago this was a great hotel; now it's tired and overpriced with all appearances of being run for cash for owners. The exception is the roof top restaurant, with the best views in the city, super service and very good food. If you can get your head around 300 euro for two, go for it. Just don't stay in the hotel. The first room (tired) we were offered had windows which opened onto the floor of the next door balcony; the change was to a slightly bigger room (tired, but with a fruit bowl) with a view onto a small courtyard on one side, and onto a construction/roofing storage area on the other. The morning clanging and cursing sounded, well, like builders moving large sheets of metal. At 6-7am. An expensive dump (restaurant and bar excepted) -- hugely disappointing. Wouldn't go back for the world.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel with Great Service- Restaurant is overly expensive”
Reviews.Author: gotobermuda
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, perched on a high street, within walking distance to the Spanish Steps. The service was great and the mood was elegant. The concierge was always available and helpful. Rooms are on the small side, but nicely furnished and comfortable. The bed could be more comfortable, but I was able to sleep well. The bathrooms are tiny, but very elegant and clean. Excellent maid service, always coming twice daily. My main complaint lies with the cost of the restaurant. The quality of the food is very good, and the service was also friendly and efficient with a breathtaking view of Rome. However, I have travelled the world, and I have never seen such ridiculous prices for both breakfast and lunch. It is a wonder how anyone shows up there. A buffet breakfast for one person is listed on the menu at 55 Euros. A small lunch for four cost me around 250 euros. Very few people seem to attend breakfast and lunch, and the ones who do typically have it included with their room. I would ask the hotel, would it not help to lower prices? Then, more people would attend and less food would be wasted on a daily basis. I purposely looked outside the hotel for food, because I could not justify spending that amount on a small daily breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel, great location, not cheap”
Reviews.Author: IlGenio
Reviews.Content: This is a luxury hotel, with excellent location, in the posh via Veneto area, walking distance from the Spanish steps. It is expensive, but it allows you to have breakfast in the magnificent Terrazza dell'Eden which probably enjoys the best views of Rome. The decor is classic, with marbles and statues. The rooms are small but very well equipped (Penhaligon's toiletries) and the bathrooms are new. Rooms are made twice a day.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Convenient Top Notch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EADR
Reviews.Content: My husband and 10 year old son and I spent a night at Hotel Eden in Rome prior to us catching a flight home to NY after a long vacation . We have been to Rome several times before but have never stayed at the Hotel Eden. We found the location to be excellent, right near the Spanish Steps and just off the Via Veneto, but a very quiet street. The hotel is a small luxury hotel . Check in was seemless, and they had a room ready for us to check into a noon. We had a studio room with an extra large bed (larger than a king) and a huge marble bathroom. Breakfast was included and was fabulous --in the rooftop restaurant and with an excellent selection of fruits and other foods.We have stayed at the St Regis several times before, and although the Hotel Eden is not as opulent, we found the location and service to be as good or better--especially given the lower cost.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, one of the best in Rome”
Reviews.Author: travel_diva_4126
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in March for a business trip, but brought my husband and toddler with me. The hotel was very nice, especially for Rome. The room was a bit on the small side, but had everything one would need/want. The only problem we had was that there was virtually no water pressure, leading to very little (if at all) water for a shower. When there was water, it was very difficult to control its temperature, leading to some scalding moments. The staff were very nice. The hotel states that it is near the Spanish Steps...they are quite a hike away. However, the hotel is in a nice, quiet area.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel but mixed service quality”
Reviews.Author: prg210
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful hotel and is very comfortable. Two things sincerely rubbed me the wrong way. One was the value of the restaurant. It was way overpriced! The stuffed zucchini flowers were amazing, but I payed 40 euro for an OK pasta dish, and 28 euro for a tiramisu parfait that had clearly been prepared in advance, and was still frozen. The breakfast buffet was also more expensive than the St. Regis, with less variety. We were missing a hairdryer in our room, and we had noticed the sign in the bathroom noting that it was in the desk drawer. After checking every drawer, I decided to call guest services. Before I could finish telling the woman we didn't have a hairdryer, she interrupted me with a grunt and an attitude saying "YES YOU DO, SIR! It is in the drawer." I then insisted that we do not ,and that I was aware it should have been in the drawer. She sighed and said she would send someone up. When the woman arrived, she did not have a hair dryer, and double checked to see if it was there. I felt like they assumed I was lying or was stupid and did not read the directions. It was really insulting, and by the time we received the hairdryer, we were running late for dinner. The correct response when I called down should have been "Did you check the drawer sir?" "It's not there? We'll send one up, I do apologize" When I had brought concerns to the desk upon check-out, there was an unsympathetic "I'm sorry." and nothing was done.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, great location but worth getting upgraded room”
Reviews.Author: Place57
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Rome for the third time in four years on vacation. We absolutely love Rome! We stayed at other five star hotels in Rome, Lord Bryon(nice hotel, inconvenient location) the first time and Hotel de Russie(pricey, great location) the second time. We prefer Hotel Eden because it is a discrete and elegant hotel and conveniently located. If one is looking for more flash and a hotel right in the middle of things as soon as you step out, then Hotel de Russie is probably a better choice. Eden is tucked away on a quiet street but if you walk a couple of blocks, then you are by the Spanish Steps, the best shopping, restaurants, etc. I know some people have been disappointed by the small size of the standard room at the Eden or the room being nothing particularly special for the high price. I think there is some truth to that for the basic standard room. However, keep in mind that European hotel standards are generally lower than those in America. Also, the Eden is a "grand dame" hotel (which is part of its charm) and not some ultra modern property in suburban Florida. We paid for an upgraded room and it makes all the difference! It's much bigger and better appointed. I understand the suites are even nicer but obviously more expensive. There are no two rooms that are alike though at the hotel. The big downside is how exorbitant the breakfast (as well as the minbar and lobby drink service) is at the hotel. Breakfast was roughly $70+ per person, and we decided it was not worth having at the hotel . We instead went to a local bar/cafe a 5 minute walk from the hotel and had a wonderful capuccino/espresso and warm panino and saw the bustling local scene which was more interesting to us. Someone mentioned on Tripadvisor that they thought the sheets were rough. This is probably due to that reviewer having never encountered linen sheets before. The hotel uses actual linen sheets which was crisp and cool and especially inviting on hot summer nights in July. As far as the staff, we thought they could be more polished and accomodating. They are a bit standoffish, which may be unintential on their part Conclusion: We would stay at the Eden when we go back Rome but opt for an upgraded room/suite. If you are going to stay here, stay at the room categories above "standard"

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in the world to stay on honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: mags972
Reviews.Content: So... we thought we saved the best hotel for last on our honeymoon. Sadly this was not the case. We arrived after a long day of traveling to be told that the rate we booked, was not the rate they were going to honor and it would actually be 700 euros more for our total stay. We were not on business, we are younger than the average guest at this hotel but this is no excuse to be treated poorly. The hotel was told several times we were coming for our honeymoon but yet this was our welcome from a Starwoods fine hotel. My husband was upset but said fine because we were dirty and tired from traveling. We went to our room that was pretty, nothing special, but very small. In this room, there was a fruit basket with a note for a male business guest, not for us.. at this point we were angry. Here we are expecting a fairytale experience at a 5 star hotel and it was just so poor and so sad for us. My husband called down three times and was hung up on(first night of our honeymoon in Italy.. yes. true story) and had to call starwoods directly to be put on hold for an hour to address the rate and the random fruit basket for the guest the hotel actually cared about. We were then told by starwoods customer service that they would not adjust the rate but would send us a box of chocolates to ease our pain. Real words said to a starwoods gold member. We packed our stuff and left the hotel. When we checked out for our hour stay the manager on duty at the front desk was the most sarcastic jerk I have ever met. Should not be working in hospitality at a fine hotel. This was probably the worst experience I have ever had traveling and I don't think anyone, honeymoon or not, should ever stay here. The italians running this hotel could learn a thing or two from the hospitality at hotels in the United States. I will never stay at a Starwoods hotel again. There is a little bed and breakfast a block away from this hotel, great people, great service, great rooms, great prices. It is called the Beau Site.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful service, classic property”
Reviews.Author: dupedtourist
Reviews.Content: A lovely, classic property perched on the hill between the Via Veneto and the Spanish Steps without the hustle and bustle of those attractions and 1 block from the Villa Borghese park. Being in a quiet neighborhood is a real advantage in busy Rome. At $380 Euros, this is not cheap but it is quiet and refined with outstanding concierge and front desk help. Everyone speaks English and is as helpful as they can be, including delivering boarding passes that I emailed to the front desk at 1:00 on a Saturday night. The concierge suggested a great neighborhood restaurant in its own secluded small piazza (complete with fountain) called Antica Osteria in the antique section of old Rome and it was very, very good. The chambermaids were prompt and thorough and the manager did me a personal favor by allowing me to use Starwood points for one night's stay despite not booking this option online ahead of time which is required. My room was spacious (by Rome standards) and had adequate air conditiiong which was important, as it was 98 degrees and humid. The room shutters keep out all noise. The bathroom was tile and marble with plenty of hot water and space. If you walk around the neighborhood you can find nice local places to eat and drink without dealing with the craziness of the Spanish Steps, Piazza Navonna, etc. There are also super small leather and fashion stores tucked away on the side streets here. The bar and restaurant on the roof is very good but pricey. Highly recommended and will return, especially using Starwood points. Be aware that this is a 20,000 points a night property though.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Promontory
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here and overall were pleased. The hotel is beautiful and in a great location, we loved that it was within walking distance to all the major attractions. The view of the city from the top floor restaurant is amazing. We enjoyed starting the morning with breakfast overlooking Rome and St. Peter's. Everything was up to expectations except for two areas: The sheets on the bed were extremely rough and scratchy, my husband had a hard time sleeping because of it. The breakfast is ridiculously expensive, even for the most basic things like oatmeal, coffee and water. Other than that, it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: queenofsleep
Reviews.Content: What really stood out was the excellent service and professionalism of all staff from check in to check out. The concierge service was incredibly useful and they made some excellent recomendations. We had a deluxe room which was very nice and clean although the furniture was dated and the tv was rather small. The old furniture does add charater but is not very functional. For example drawers were stiff and did not align. The bed was very comfortable and we were given a fruit bowl which was replenished daily. The location is good. Walking distance from the Spanish Steps, Via Condotti (shopping street) and Borghese park. We had the breakfast once as it was not included with our room and I don't think the breakfast is worth the price charged considering there are quite a few authentic cafes within walking distance of the hotel offering much cheaper breakfasts. All in all it was a very good stay and lived up to our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels in Rome !”
Reviews.Author: Misshessia
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located behind the Spanish steps not far away from the main Shopping Area. Its Charme and good Service make you feel comfortable. To recommend is having breakfast on the roof top Terrasse and for a Bellini at night.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a letdown”
Reviews.Author: jada19
Reviews.Content: We booked a studio suite, and were disappointed in our room, which looked nothing like the pictures in the brochure or the internet. Our friends stayed in a standard room, which was absolutely nothing special, and quite dated. We had plumbing issues; when water was drained out of the tub it came back in through a drain in the floor and flooded the bathroom. They fixed it, but it was really kind of gross, and we had to clean up the mess afterwards. The location is a bit over-hyped. It is across the street from a lovely park, but you can't go directly across into the park. Instead you have to walk down about three blocks before crossing into the park. Also, the park can't be seen from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, posh hotel with accommodating staff and nice facilities.”
Reviews.Author: JJJ13035
Reviews.Content: This hotel has about 130 rooms but we rarely saw more than two or three other small groups of guests. The location is superb - near shopping and dining on Via Venetto as well as sightseeing (The Spanish Steps and Villa Borghese are both very close by). The restaurant has a solid breakfast buffet (though at 54 EUR it's not for everyone!); we had dinner there one evening; the food was superb and priced comparably to the breakfast (read: expensive). We were there at a very hot time (36C/95+F) and the air conditioning struggled against the high ceiling of our room - the temperature never seemed to get below about 78F. This was true in both rooms held by my group. Hardly a major issue, but in a hotel rooms that start at 400 EUR it's noteworthy. The small fitness center had excellent equipment, including dumbells, elliptical machines, treadmills, stationary bicycles, and Nautilus machines (leg press and chest press, as I recall). There is also a Turkish steam room and an aromatherapy shower; I used neither of those. Towels and water were provided. The concierge desk was friendly and helpful at all times and with several different people. The front desk staff and bell staff were as well. I checked the "elegant" box as part of this review. The hotel's guests were not necessarily elegant - ourselves included - as there seemed to be many Europeans and Americans on vacation in shorts and t-shirts. The decor of the hotel, though, was very elegant - lots of classical art pieces, marble everywhere, plants and flowers... all very tasteful and appropriate for the space.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: hinckly
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Eden three nights. Although the room was a bit small, it had a balcony with a great view of the city. The roof-top bar was extremely pleasant with a semi-enclosed patio where they had set up a TV for the World Cup. The staff was very hospitable, engaging in conversation and making sure the single traveller belonged. Walter is probably one of the best servers I've ever met. He had great suggestions and took the time to point out the sights (all seven hills of Rome are visible from here!). The housekeeping was top notch, not trying to change the room while I was there, which is often a problem at other hotels. The front desk staff, and concierge were equally professional, efficient, and friendly. They went out of their way to ensure I knew where I was going and how to get there. The food was phenomenal, if a bit pricey. I will definitely stay there the next time in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Teacher57
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to rome for a romantic weekend. A wonderful city. We stayed at the Hotel Eden. It is fairly central and we found it very easy to walk from there to any of the famous sites throughout the city. The hotel itself was beautiful. Quite luxurious, with excellent service. The only downside was the price!! We looked at the dinner menu and found it not only way beyond reasonable, but also a rather limited selection and nothing to our taste! We enjoyed finding little restaurants throughout the streest of Rome and have to say that we found some real beauties. The staff were helpful and the rooms clean and spacious. An ideal place to spend a romantic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid hotel and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: lovetraveling0213
Reviews.Content: Our last night in Italy after two weeks of traveling Rome, Florence, Venice, Cinque Terre, and Amalfi Coast ended in our last night at the Hotel Eden. We were here as Gold Starwood Preferred Guests on points. We were upgraded to a nicer room without having to ask. What a wonderful and unexpected surprise this hotel was. Our room was wonderful and the largest we had in all of Italy with a nice hallway leading to our room. The location to the Spanish Steps was also a plus. We were exhausted from 2 straight weeks of sightseeing that we just spent our last night in Rome relaxing in the room. The view was also great. Nothing but good things to say!!

Reviews.Title: “Second time and still incredible”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaBender
Reviews.Content: This is a hoyel where you immediately feel welcomed. Yes expensive but w/o the attitude. Staff are more than accomodating and nothing is a problem. This is my second time in Rome in 2 years and second time I have stayed at the Eden. Rooms are lovely, clean, and bright. Concierge are knowledgeable and friendly. Management runs the place like a fine tuned watch and always a smile. BRAVO!

Reviews.Title: “Decent experience but a bit of a hassle”
Reviews.Author: Trevi
Reviews.Content: I’m a Starwood Gold member and used my points for a stay here at the Hotel Eden (a premium level hotel - 25k / night). I reserved a standard room with a king size bed, divided into two twins and requested a room with a view of the city, realizing it was a long shot but with status, we were entitled to an upgrade if a room was available. When we arrived, before the standard check-in time, the desk told me that they had arranged a room with a view, but it would take a little longer since they were cleaning it. No problem, especially if it has a great view. I was assured that it did. We went to the Terrace Restaurant, which prior posters had mentioned. The view was great; we had 2 glasses of prosecco and shared an appetizer of 4 stuffed zucchini flowers (79 euro!) they were good, but not $100 good. Upon arriving to our room we found that the view was of the parking lot and a basketball court – no view of the city. It was very small and had 1 bed – it looked like a full size bed. The front desk handled my complait professionally. The manager took me to look at an alternative and we agreed to move. They were very gracious. The new room was much larger, arranged with two twins, on the first floor on an inner courtyard. This is a beautiful hotel. Once we arrived and were settled in the ‘right’ room we were happy there.

Reviews.Title: “There are lots of hotels in Rome,this used to be one to stay in,NO MORE!”
Reviews.Author: elainevedette
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Eden 4 times over many years,most recently two years ago,it was always lovely and that is why I returned!But Never Again!! I was a walk in and was told the rate at the desk was cheaper than the American Express Platinum rate (not true),I paid 340 Euro(a discount after I complained about the size of the room) for a twin bed in a room the size of a closet with a nice view. The concierge sent me to a very touristy place to eat,I speak Italian and made my way to a better spot "TUNA" after dinner I returned took a bath and when I unplugged the tub water came gushing out of the wall across from the bath behind the bidet!! Flooding the bathroom and part of the bedroom! It was 12pm I called the front desk to inform them and told them since I had to be up at 6am to get to the airport I was going to sleep but they had better look at it the morning. A half an hour the phone rang waking me and I told them I was asleep. The best part of the stay was the front door valet who told me to park the car across the street in the carpark for less than 20 euro a night as the hotel charges 60 euro a night! Arriving home tonight I got a letter from the manager telling me my experience was unusual, well I certainly thought so! This hotel is a rip off with surly staff and past its prime. A great disappointment. And American Express and Virtuoso and other travel companies that rate it so highly should take a better look at what they offer for 340 euro a night! Next time I will be staying somewhere else and you should too!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel... and Very Expensive!”
Reviews.Author: brytpa
Reviews.Content: The overall impression I came away with after staying at the Hotel Eden is that it's an extremely nice hotel, yet also incredibly expensive. Mind you, pricey Rome hotels are by no means a rarity! But travelers should be warned costs can most definitely add up at the Hotel Eden - beware those incidentals! Booked in to Hotel Eden for 6 nights in November, 2010. Booked through a Starwood promo (pay for 4 nights, get 2 additional nights free), so I felt pretty good about things heading in as I'd saved a hefty chunk of money by getting those last 2 nights free. At check-in, I was told I'd been given a larger room than I'd reserved on account of Starwood Platinum status. It was to be an interior courtyard room, though. I asked if they could still give me the smaller room-type I'd originally reserved, yet with an exterior view. The front desk happily obliged that request, and the views are definitely worth it from this hotel! Wonderful views from many upper floor rooms and from the restaurant/bar on the top floor. It's located on a higher point of Rome, so the views from our window were wonderful and well worth a smaller room. The actual room itself was a bit small, but having stayed in many a European hotel room it didn't strike me as unusually small - if anything, it was quite normal and as expected. Bathroom was almost as big as the room itself! Huge bathroom, and quite a luxurious one at that. Room was very quiet (no hallway noise, and windows did a good enough job shutting out street noise... unless there was a car horn honking marathon taking place out in the street... it happens often enough in Rome!). Service was great throughout the stay - helpful staff, friendly staff, attentive and efficient. Hotel Eden has a reputation for being one of the nicer hotels in the city and quite the history behind it, and it seemed to me the staff were genuinely proud of that and interested in maintaining it. They always seemed eager to accommodate various requests - for additional room amenities; moving a table closer to the window in the bar to better soak in the better views; a pot of coffee delivered to the room at specific times each day, and so on. Now... on to those incidentals! Breakfast is anything but cheap! It came out to over 80 Euro per person! Needless to say, we did that only once. A Coke from the mini-bar? Around 15 Euro. Those daily pots of coffee? OK... not cheap, but quite a bargain relative to everything else! Internet connection came at a price, food, drinks, etc. Despite any savings from those 2 free nights, incidentals most definitely brought the total price back up quite quickly before the end of the trip! I should add that some friends were staying at a nearby hotel of similar standards, and found their experience there to be the same. So it could very well just be how it is with higher-end hotels in this part of Rome. Just be prepared! Location-wise, it's great. Short walks to many sights. Many other reviews mention the Spanish Steps being just a couple blocks away. Indeed, they are! But many other great sites or also just short walks away, and there are great streets and neighborhoods to stroll through all around. Mind you, walking to the sights from the hotel will almost always be downhill - which makes for an uphill return! If you tire yourself out walking around, a taxi back to the hotel could be worth considering! So, if you're aware of how expensive this place can get and are ok with it, I think you'll be more than pleased and happy at Hotel Eden. If you're the savvy traveler who can find good prices on rooms, and then avoid incidentals (ask hotel to clear out minibar so you can use it as a fridge... stay off the internet... don't order any movies... never dine at the hotel... etc), I'd imagine you would also be very happy here. But if incidental charges are a problem and you don't want to pay too much more than the cost of room itself, either stay away or be prepared!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: candacegar
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating a special anniversary and planned a 5-star trip to the UK and Italy. This hotel was very nice. The rooms are lovely and the staff was friendly. It was located in a great place, very near the Spanish Steps. My only complaint would be that the door men are very "snooty." Otherwise, I would have given a 5-star rating. Hotel staff can very much hinder an otherwise great time. I suggest that management should offer some training in how to be friendly and charming.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 30th wedding anniversary at the eden”
Reviews.Author: opcathy
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival we were upgraded to a front facing room, overlooking Rome. We had dinner in their restaurant which was wonderful, with fantastic views. The breakfast room served fresh blood orange juice, and once again "views to die for". We found the staff very helpful, including great recommendations for dining by the concierge. The location of this hotel is perfect to walking to all the sites, and don't miss the park, (their version of central park) just blocks from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No Regard for Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: mfinn624
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from an 8 day trip to Italy (Florence/Rome) and are frequent customers of Starwood Hotels. The Eden has a lot to learn in customer service from other hotels in the Starwood brand. I'm not sure if it is just a cultural difference or what, but the annoyance conveyed to us by the concierge to the attitudes front desk, has assured that we will never stay at the Hotel Eden again- prime location or not.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, posh and secluded -- two minutes from the Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: SF_EXEC
Reviews.Content: I came to Rome for the weekend while I was in Frankfurt for business. This was my first trip to The Eternal City. I lucked out with the Eden Hotel -- from the moment I walked in the door, the staff was perfectly charming and gracious. The hotel is on a small, quiet side street overlooking the park that surrounds the Villa Borghese. I had booked a Jr. Suite, and they upgraded me to the Villa Medici Suite which -- to be perfectly honest -- probably accounts somewhat for my very positive review. I had come to Rome to do a little sightseeing -- just where I could walk easily -- a little shopping and a lot of eating and hanging out. The restaurant on the top floor of the hotel is very, very good -- and very, very expensive (dinner will come to about 100 euros per person, without alcohol). I asked the concierge to make some spa appointments for me, and dinner reservations for the second night I was there, and I was very happy with his recommendations. The hotel itself is beautiful, very well-maintained and luxurious (linen sheets, for example -- not sure if this is just in the suites). I could not have asked for a better introduction to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Update-- Hotel Eden Delivered”
Reviews.Author: LABill
Reviews.Content: This is an update to a review I previously posted for the Hotel Eden . My family , with 2 kids -13 and 12 years old- stayed for 4 nights at the Hotel on a spring break trip in April 2010. We first spent 3 nights at this hotel ( which is the subject of my first review) and then left for 2 nights in Florence and then returned for one more night in Rome at the Hotel Eden, When we arrived back at the Eden, the hotel upgraded us to the Royal Suite without us even asking . This was a great room and my kids were amazed at this treatment. We arragemnt airport transportation via the hotel which was reasonable in price and was quite nice. I will return to the hotel in September when we are next in Rome

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets”
Reviews.Author: DerbyshireItalyfan
Reviews.Content: Excellent location .Room very spacious,clean and well appointed.Our room (deluxe) overlooked a reasonably pleasant courtyard and was very quiet.Staff all very helpful,well informed , professional and as friendly as you would want without being over the top.Bathroom large and well appointed with best water pressure ever found in a hotel.View from breakfast area is amazing .The buffet breakfast was very good but very expensive.The "trainee waitress" deserves a special mention for her efforts.This is a traditional hotel which has managed to keep very high standards and style.Had read reviews before booking .Its amazing how different people see things.I thought the wooden floor in the bedroom was beautiful and perfect in a 1889 building and if you can buy those curtains in Walmart I wish they sold them in the U.K! Yes, the bar area is a smoking area ,although very few guests smoked but there is a NO smoking area next to it with the same amazing view-this is stated clearly in the information in the bedroom. The only downside is the very high prices in the mini bar perhaps they could offer a cheaper bottle of water. We will use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Major Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: YSTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Rome for a long weekend, major birthday celebration. As we were getting on the plane, we booked the hotel for 4 nights through American Express Centurion requesting a deluxe room facing the front with a balcony. AE informed us that the requested rooms were available but couldn’t be guaranteed. The booking also included “a stay 3 nights, get 4th night free” special being offered by the hotel. Imagine our surprise when we got there the next morning 12 hours after we booked and were told there were no rooms with balconies available. We were offered an “upgrade” to a suite on the first floor looking out to a municipal garage or a studio room looking into an interior airway. We chose the suite, simply for size as none of the standard rooms had a view much different than the upgrades. We were warned that it could be slightly noisy due to traffic on the street adjoining the hotel. Since we live in New York, that didn’t bother us. But we were not warned that there were two other unusual noise problems we discovered that night: you could hear the water pipes in the wall all night, and that, starting at 5:30 am until midnight or 1:30 am, the room shakes from a nearby metro line which rumbles by underground every few minutes. In general, while the size of the room itself was adequate, it needed a major renovation. This room (room 114) was what would generally be called an executive suite, with a small bedroom separated by French doors from a sitting area; it could hardly be called a nice suite. The furnishings were old and dowdy. The wood floors were faded and worn. The draperies looked old and tired and were made of cheap fabric (think Wal-Mart). The king bed was not, but rather two twins put together with ugly stripe twin fabric headboards attached to the wall. There was no hairdryer in the bathroom due to “security” reasons (The real reason was that there was no plug in the bathroom). We stay in the very best hotels throughout the world and this definitely would not qualify for five stars in any of them. When I asked for a different suite and offered to pay additional, I was told that they were all booked by families with kids. Needless to say, I saw only one child in the four days that we spent at the hotel. Also shocking were the “extra” prices. A coke in the bar on the roof was 10 Euro; internet service in the room, 26 Euro; pasta in the restaurant, 35-45 Euro; appetizers in the restaurant, 45 Euro; a tiny bags of chips in the room’s minibar, 10 Euro. Even without considering the times and that the Eden is a Starwood property—so they are certainly aware of what is going on in the world—I find these prices ridiculous. When we went to check out, I was not surprised to see that we had been charged for all four nights despite the fact that we specifically confirmed the special when we checked in. After disputing the charge, the hotel went back and checked the original reservations, or so they said—I think they were trying to see if they could get away with it either because we might not notice, or more likely they have learned that not every American makes a scene to get what what was agreed to. In any event, whatever the reason, I shouldn’t have had to find the “error” and get it corrected. On the plus side, the hotel is very well located and the staff is generally pleasant and seems to try hard. However, for a five star hotel, their concierges really don’t seem to understand what is considered a high-end, foodie restaurant. They steered us to restaurants that may have been great in the past, but certainly wouldn’t be considered gourmet on the international level. It would behoove the hotel to have the main concierge person actually eat at all the top restuarants. Also it would be helpful to have copies of the menus from the top restaurants available at the concierge as most fine hotels do. Unfortunately, we did not get to see any rooms with a balcony (all on the fifth floor), but I do believe that those and other rooms on the fifth floor may have been renovated as the hallways on the fifth floor have been redone. So if you stay at the Eden, insist on the fifth-floor with a balcony (even if they say they won’t guarantee it, insist on the reference in their confirmation, or take the Presidential suite if you don’t mind spending too much for a room in this hotel). Also, know that if you book through American Express, you will in all likelihood be given a studio with a horrible interior view, or a “suite” upgrade, which will likely be room 114, as that seems to be their method of operation for dealing with the upgrade. We will not be back until they renovate the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Rome sweet Rome”
Reviews.Author: Helenblack123
Reviews.Content: this is a Royal Meridien Hotel. Great location and beautiful facility.

Reviews.Title: “charm and hospitality, Perfect together”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyPatD
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Italy. Eden was recommended by a friend, and we were not disappointed. Charming, beautifully decorated, and pefect location. We found the staff to be extremely helpful. Our room was large, bed comfortable, gorgeous bathroom. Restaurant expensive, but the roof top bar a great place for a drink w/ wonderful snacks. Breathtaking views. Great restaurants right around the corner, lots of places for coffee + in the morning. If you go a little off season, you may get a good deal for this exceptional luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Crown of Rome”
Reviews.Author: RoccoDiCardielli
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the most amazing hotels I have ever had the pleasure staying in. We were getting married and the staff was SO attentive, catering and helpful. The concierge in this hotel takes the cake as the BEST I have EVER known. They overheard us when we arrived from our 12 hour flight about how hungry we were...I wished for a grilled cheese sandwich and my wife to be wished for fresh baked cookies. As we checked in and the concierge/bellhop took our luggage, we were given advice on restaurants, maps, etc. in less than fifteen min we were on the elevator to our rooms...upon entering our room...the concierge had FRESH HOT cookies on a plate for the "Mrs to be" and my grilled cheese steam still rising next to it...AMAZING. That is service. I will never forget their kindness and hospitality. Bella Encantare!

Reviews.Title: “stressful stay and rude staff - would not reccomend!”
Reviews.Author: natroden
Reviews.Content: The view from the breakfast room was superb.The staff were unhelpful and the manager was rude and arrogant. There was smashing going on over the room that we stayed in that stopped us sleeping all night and we received no apology from the manager, and instead, he treated the situation in the most appalling manor, turning the situation on us. I am never going to return to this hotel again and warn anyone thinking of staying at this hotel that there are many far better ones very nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Old World sophistication with views of Central Rome”
Reviews.Author: TheOregonTrail
Reviews.Content: THE SITUATION: My husband and I celebrated our wedding anniversary with a trip to France and Italy in May 2009. This was our first time in Rome. We booked our room at the Hotel Eden via the Starwood Preferred Guest program's Cash & Points offer. THE LOCATION: The Hotel Eden is located on the Pincian Hill, off the Via Veneto in the northern section of central Rome. While it is not far from the Spanish Steps, with its tourist groups, honeymooners, designer shopping bag-toting ladies, loitering teens and hustling street buskers, the Hotel Eden feels a world apart. The street in front of the hotel, Via Ludovisi, can be busy during the day as cars fly by. The closest Metro stations are at Spagna (Piazza di Spagna / Spanish Steps) and at the foot of Via Veneto (Barberini). This is useful for getting to/from sites like the Colosseum and the Ancient Roman Forum, Vatican City, and so on. However, the hotel is on a small hill so if you have heavy luggage, make arrangements with a taxi or car service instead of tuckering yourself out on the incline. The 116 bus stops along Via Veneto en route to the historic center of Rome; sometimes it was a small electric "taxi", which we often had to ourselves to/from the Pantheon. The reservations-only Galleria Borghese is a nearby treat if you are interested in High Renaissance and Baroque art (particularly sculptures by Bernini). THE LOBBY: The hotel exudes class from the moment you step in past the uniformed porters and are greeted by the front of house. There is a Brioni boutique on the ground floor, should you need an Italian suit. THE ROOM: We stayed in Room no. 404, a corner unit facing south, with a partial view of "Il Vittoriano", the moment to Vittorio Emanuele II near the Ancient Roman Forum. The room was decently sized, with a plush bed, walk-in closet, dresser and modestly sized LCD TV (the personalized greeting on the TV was a nice touch). The room itself was handsome, with beautiful wallpaper and corniced ceilings. The marble bathroom was beautiful, with toiletries by Penhaligon's and Marvis. We were also impressed by the hot water delivery in the shower/tub combo. High-speed Internet was available for a fee (hourly or flat daily rate). Street noise was somewhat audible when the windows were open, but when closed it wasn't a bother. FOOD & SERVICE: The concierge desk was charming and aim to please; they made great conversation (in good English), including letting us know who won the Spanish F1 Grand Prix the previous weekend (we missed it when our prior accommodations in the Cinque Terre didn't have a functioning TV). The welcome gift was a box of pates de fruits. The hotel's restaurant, La Terrazza dell'Eden, boasts a Michelin star and extraordinary views of Rome, but we were content with splurging on a bottle of red (with complimentary apertivi) in the piano bar and watching the sun set behind St. Peter's. One of the great highlights of our trip. If I didn't snag a SPG awards room, I don't know if I'd ever have thought of staying at the Hotel Eden due to its high price (normally out of my price range), but I would recommend it to friends and fellow SPG members who have the means to experience this slice of Old World elegance.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the view”
Reviews.Author: hgeslin
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel for business trip. The room was nice but a bit small. I really enjoy the main restaurant offering an impressive view on the city, the food was good but not excellent. The service offered was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Metzgermeister
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic city break in this hotel. It is very convinient located - just a few minutes from the Spanish stairs and via Condotti. It is a very charming and historic Grand Hotel. The staff is exceptionally friendly, the room was very clean. I already had better breakfasts in other hotels, but the view from the top floor is breath-taking. There was piano player and a live singer in the evening in the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: jagangjee
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with a great staff! It is walking distance to everything! Literally 1 block away from the Spanish Steps, which was great as we relaxed there almost each night. Right across the street of Villa Borghese. Walking distance to the Piazza del Popolo (7 min), Trevi Fountain (15 min), Colosseum (25-30 min), Pantheon and Piazza Navona (20 min), Piazza della Repubblica (25 min) and Vatican (was 1 hour and would not recommend it). We checked into the hotel the lobby is truly old world...marble throughout the lobby, the finest wood and silks used for furniture, this hotel has a lot of class. Even the elevators had the old world charm as they were smaller and could only accommodate about 4 people comfortably. We were escorted up to our room on the top floor where we had small terrace with magnificent view of the tops of the Trinità dei Monti, with Basilica di San Pietro in the background...it made for some of the most amazing sunsets. The restaurant at the top of the hotel, La Terrazza, easily has the best views of the city! The price for dinner is expensive so we opted to have drinks and watch the sunset up their one night, one of our most memorable evenings. The staff was very courteous, professional and was more than willing to take our photographs multiple times. Overall, this is a great hotel and yes is it expensive as it is a Luxury Hotel, but is worth the price for the charm, staff, views and location. The Concierge was by far the most knowledgeable that we had on any of our trips and was very helpful. Departing Roma we needed to take the train to Napoli and he helped organize everything for our trip. He could have easily charges us to do it himself, instead he took the time to tell me what I needed to do and printed all the train time tables.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Eden - Rome, Italy”
Reviews.Author: HavePPWillTravel
Reviews.Content: One of the most amazing hotels I have ever stayed in. The people at the front desk were very helpful & knowledgable. This hotel is literally a block away from the Spanish Steps. Do you like to feel that you're in the center of it all but can step away for some quiet? The Spanish steps can be very busy with shoppers & entertainment, however, at this hotel you can feel like you are able to step away from the business & relax.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at Hotel Eden”
Reviews.Author: groverly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in early September - a beautiful room on the 4th floor. It was amazing. The room was beautiful and the bathroom nearly as large as our bedroom at home! Loved that we had real windows that actually opened - usuallly not the case in U.S. hotels. Staff was very friendly and helpful - impeccable service. We had a drink on the top floor bar - expensive, but worth it for the ambiance and great view. We did not eat at the hotel, because we had picked other places that we were interested in trying. The hotel was a short walk from the Spanish Steps - we had great weather and enjoyed wandering through the neighborhoood.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: erock60
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Eden for 3 nights in mid September, and had an excellent visit. The hotel staff was extremely helpful, the room was in great condition, and the location just a few minutes from the Spanish Steps was perfect. The hotel is just far enough away from the hot spots that it is quiet and relaxing, but close enough that we walked everywhere! Two thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could rate higher...excellent location, not so excellent room”
Reviews.Author: lmct
Reviews.Content: This was the last stop on our 2 week trip to Italy and I had high expectations. We had been to Rome before and stayed at the lovely St. Regis (using SPG points), so wanting to try another Starwood property, I chose the Eden over the Westin as we were looking for a smaller hotel and this did fit the bill. Also as other have commented - their location and overall service was very good. I did read other reviews stating that when checking in using Starwood points, the room you would be offered may be disappointing - well - I guess I should not have been suprised when we were lead through a maze of hallways to the last room on the line! Since we were only staying for a couple nights I didn't complain - but somehow felt like we were being put in the far off reaches of the hotel - away from "paying" guests. Funny, because as SPG gold level - it means I do quite a bit of traveling not on points. The room was just ok, it was small but with a nice bathroom and one window onto a courtyard and another into an alley. I will comment that although pricey - do make time to grab a cocktail to see views from the terrace restaurant and lounge - lovely, But - avoid the breakfast trap - all we wanted our final morning was coffee - and for $17 euro I learned my lesson. Although a charming hotel, next time I will try either the Westin or go back to the St. Regis - just not the Starwood experience I was hoping for.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced but in a pretty good location...”
Reviews.Author: aroundtheworlddoc
Reviews.Content: It was once a great hotel but has fallen to disrepair over the past few years. Its more expensive than many of the surrounding hotels and does not offer much more than the others. I have stayed here a few times before but will not likely stay here again unless they renovate. The best part of the rooms are the bathrooms, otherwise its much like the others. The hotel is quite expensive and the breakfast alone costs $75 per person, although the view is prob one of the best in Rome. My friends stayed at the Hotel Lancelot for about half the price and enjoyed their stay. Others stayed around Via Veneto and enjoyed their stay as well for less. Overall its an ok hotel in a good location that will cost you big bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Eden took good care of us.”
Reviews.Author: hopetoseeitall
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Eden for five nights and had chosen it in large part due to Tripadvisor reviews. It is rather pricey, but we got it as part of a package with our flights from Expedia so we received a significantly reduced rate from the hotel only rates. Our room was a double-deluxe with queen bed. It was very roomy and the bathroom was large and well appointed. Although everything was not bright, shiny and new, it was clean and comfortable. The sheets were crisp linen which I thought was unusual and would be uncomfortable, but we slept just fine. I was worried that since we were on the first floor that traffic noise would be a problem, but the drivers only seemed to love their horns during daylight hours. I would have liked to stay on a higher floor for the views, but there was not one available for our stay. We walked all over Rome and rarely used the public transportation. Hotel Eden has a great central location. It is on a hill so when you walk away it's always downhill and when you return it's always uphill. That makes the views more enjoyable, but when you are tired at the end of the day the climb seems steeper. We didn't eat in the restaurant on the top floor. It is very expensive (minimum 110 euros apiece plus wine), but we did go up there before dinner guests were seated and allowed to look around and take lots of pictures. I would agree with the reviewers who have said it has one of the most spectacular views of Rome. The staff was very helpful with any request we had. They were fluent in English and always friendly and gracious. Unlike some reviewers, I found them to be responsive eager to help. I would recommend Hotel Eden and stay there again if I am fortunate enough to return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “There's better value for your euro elsewhere in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Frenchchic
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Eden is charming...from the lobby and it has a good location, true. These two things alone however are not enough to justify its expensive price. In its day I'm sure the Eden was a great place to stay, but it is sorely in need of a sprucing up. The room we were first given was awful. It in no way shape or form justified its €400 per night price tag. We had no hot water on our arrival and a lumpy bed (you could feel the springs when you sat). The sheets were terrible (I was told they were supposed to be fine linen, I just found them abrasive). We complained. Housekeeping staff came up and put a board underneath my side of the mattress to try and firm it up and changed the bed clothes to cotton. Unfortunately, my husband's side of the bed was worse than mine (those pesty springs again) and still, no hot water. Knowing the quality of other hotels we have stayed in in Europe and Rome in this price range we knew this was not acceptable. I complained again. This time we were upgraded to a suite, which was better. We appreciated the upgrade and the service provided, after all they didn't have to do this. I can't help but wonder though about other clients who may not complain loud enough, or unknowing Americans who think this is a normal room for the price in Rome. There are other hotels in Rome in this same price range that are actually worth it, this one isn't.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Eden is an elegant smaller hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: pricklypoppy
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Eden is a really elegant hotel. It is located on a hill above the Spanish Steps. It is within easy walking distance to the Borghese park. I stayed in room 518 with my mother and teenage daughter. The room was large and beautifully decorated. There were two balconies, one in the bedroom and one in the bathroom. Both blaconies overlooked tranquil gardens and the buildings atop the Spanish Steps. The service was impeccable. The upstairs terrace is a relaxing place to have a cool drink after a day of busy Rome. The hotel is immaculate. The housekeeping is both excellent and inconspicuous. The bathroom was incredible! It was large, entirely faced in marble, and included every amenity. The doorman, concierge, and front desk were friendly, helpful, and full of Italian charm. The hotel and surrounding neighborhood feel safe and upscale. I was traveling with a senior and a teen and the Hotel Eden provided a safe and comfortable place to stay. We were in Rome in June and the city was hot. The lobby of the hotel was always cool and we could control the air conditioning fan in our room - not always the case, especially in Italy. The Hotel Eden is superb. I would highly recommend it. Helpful hints: There is a bank machine across from the hotel entrance where you can get cash. The hotel has an airport limo but it is just as easy, and half the price, to get your own taxi by waiting in the designated line at the airport. The concierge can book rail transport or there is an American Express office in the Piazza di Spagna that can help with travel reservations. One last note: Because the hotel is situated up a hill, it can be tiring returning home after a day of sightseeing. We took a lot of taxis. However, even though most of European travel is expensive due to the current exchange rate, taxis in Rome are comparatively inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Prepare to Be Shown the Worst Room”
Reviews.Author: jordancorp
Reviews.Content: I travel enough to know that it is standard practice among some European hotels to show arriving clients to the least desirable room in hopes of off-loading it to the naive or bashful. As a Starwood Gold member (being entitled to an UPgrade, if available), I had hoped to bypass this annoying charade. But no, we were first shown to a DOWNgraded room, a category below the one we had booked and pre-paid. Forty-five minutes and two room visits later, a decent room magically appeared. Many positive hotel experiences followed, but not enough to turn around this bad start. Maybe the guy who was next to me checking into the hotel, who I thought was being rude by repeatedly asking about his upgrade actually had it right.

Reviews.Title: “Wont' be going back”
Reviews.Author: MissO73
Reviews.Content: It may be charming - but I was very disappointed with the service and amenity of Hotel Eden... especially given what they are charging. I would definitely stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good staff, seriously overpriced”
Reviews.Author: nico_ch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eden with friends for a few days. The hotel location is central and close to a large park but on top of a hill, nice when you walk down into the city, difficult when you come back with tired childrens. The staff and service was great, the rooms very clean but small and the walls thin as paper. The only staff that we found very rude and unfriendly was at the bar (but what a view from up there !). We haven't tried the food but went to restaurants and bistros nearby (incl. for breakfast). There's a good selection available. There are a lot of 4 and 5 stars hotel nearby, next time we'll try either the Westin or the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Starwood Member Beware”
Reviews.Author: MsTBailey
Reviews.Content: I had read several reviews on this site with regards to the indifferent treatment of Starwood members at the Rome hotels, but frankly believed my experience would be different. I was very wrong. The location of Hotel Eden is very central. However, from a walking point of view, be prepared for a lot of hills and stairs getting to and from the hotel. It is located at the top portion of the Spanish Steps, but you still have a very hilly area to navigate if you are a walker. That is all I have to say about the location, because after all, Rome is so beautiful. My complaints are with respect to the staff. They were incredibly rude to us. My husband and I booked one night. We were with our 14 year old son. The front desk immediately said we were not able to check in because we had three people. They further denied any possibility of upgrading the room. My gold status with Starwood meant nothing to them. I asked about transferring our reservation to the other Starwood property in Rome, and they said I would have to attempt that myself. They would not call for us. Mind you, when in Italy, most do not have direct access to phone lines like we do in the US. So although it seems like it would have been easy to start calling about for another hotel, we did not have mobile phones and Hotel Eden would not help us out. After practically begging them to let us stay at the hotel which we had booked and used 20K star points to reserve, we were ushered to the smallest room I have ever seen at a hotel. We requested some blankets for our son to pad himself from the floor, and they treated us like vagabonds. We brought to the attention of the front desk that the leg of the chair was broken, and we were accused of breaking it, even though it was caked in old dried glue from a previous attempt to mend it. I know I am sounding petty, but please understand we were in Italy 3 weeks and encountered such warmth and friendliness from Italians. All the other hotels treated us like honored guests and with common dignity. Please expect the opposite from Starwood's Hotel Eden. We moved to a hotel in Vatican City the following day, and were delighted. Save your points. Don't even consider throwing away your money at this Hotel. Yes, from the outside it looks very beautiful. But it all ends there. I wrote a letter to the hotel manager to express to him our experience. His response was consistent with the attitudes shown my family and I at the Hotel Eden, and unapologetic about the unfortunate circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Luxurious, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: lori001Houston
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel, the staff and the location. the 6th floor restaurant had an incredible view. don't miss it, even if just for morning coffee. We found the staff to be very helpful! We could walk everywhere. The only negative is that our room was very small.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed. Wish I would have chosen otherwise”
Reviews.Author: floydio
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Eden to be our escape from the bustle of Rome, but found instead a kind of snobby hotel that is still a little noisy and the AC not so good. We used Starwood points, and usually are upgraded. Not so here. We got ground level rooms, and the first room the AC did not work. I felt we were kind of shoved aside and forgotten. Generally, at a hotel of this caliber, I am followed up with to find out if everything is satisfactory. Not so here. The staff was reasonably helpful and the hotel is nice in a historical sort of way, but there is no pool and the food is terribly expensive: $70 pp breakfast! I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: MisstheDogs
Reviews.Content: Hotel Eden is in a great location -- easy walking distance from the Spanish Steps and other local attractions, such as Trevi Fountain.
