It's also a short walk from the hop-on/hop-off bus that takes you around the city. We checked in early in the morning and were immediately given a room which was a huge plus. While probably large for European hotels, the room was small by US standards. Nonetheless, the bath was modern and nice. Bed was OK. TV was modern. The hotel is on a somewhat major road, so you may hear some noise. Highly recommend the rooftof restaurant. Not cheap at all, but it has a fantastic view of Rome and both the food and service are spectacular. Make reservations early so that you get a window table. You will NOT be disappointed. Overall, the service is good, rooms are ok, but the price will shock you. Look at the location and the price and decide if this is for you. It's a modern, comfortable hotel located near a number of tourist destinations. Service was fne. Again, defintiely recommend the restaurant for an unforgettable dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - A Bit Of A Problem with The Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: jjchicago0
Reviews.Content: The Eden Hotel was wonderful. The staff was very professional, etc. It's in a great location, i,e, by the park, but close enough to walk to the sites. No issues with the hotel actually. The problem I had was with restaurant at the top of the hotel: The restaurant has a fantastic view of Rome. I called the concierge to make a reservation for 2 at 8:00 pm by the window - so I had the view while eating. The concierge said that they had 7:00 pm available - but I had to be out by 8:30 pm. Or I could opt for 9:30 pm with no restrictions and I could have a window table. I opted for the 9:30 pm reservation. When I arrived, the host wanted to sit me in the back of the restaurant with no view. I explained that the concierge reserved a window table, and that I waited for the 9:30 reservation with that intention. The host said "that isn't possible", because those tables were already reserved. Two tables with a window view were open. I pressed, and the host finally sat me at a table per my reservation. Later that night, only one other group was seated after us - that was a couple who just ordered dessert. In retrospect I don't understand what the drama was about. Given the reputation of the chef and the price range of the menu, I would have expected something more professional with less haggling. The best restaurants stick to their commitment and make you feel welcome from beginning thru end.

Reviews.Title: “Great hote with a few issues”
Reviews.Author: LReego
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 nights at the Eden. The hotel is in a nice location just off Via Veneto, a main thoroughfare of Rome. The reception staff is exceptional. The concierges are a little rushed and could be more helpful. For example we asked about the OpenTour busses and they showed us where the bus picked up, but neglected to share that you need an advance ticket (?). So we waited for 20 minutes before learning we had to buy a pass. We thought this was odd. However, they did get us into a fabulous restaurant our last night, La Pergola-- a real treat. The restaurant's views are incredible. Food was good. Sadly, we were seated next to the waiter's station and had to listen to credit card machines and the waiters chatting most of the meal, especially for the price. There is a garden restaurant but it was extremely hot on the deck. The rooms are attractive with lovely antiques and a nice flat screen tv. The issues we had were: The shower was a converted tub and very narrow so your feet were on angels up each side of the tub making it a little hard to stand. The sheets were the most uncomfortable we have ever slept on--my daughter nailed it when she said they felt like sandpaper. Where are the Heavenly beds??? Also, on two of the mornings, we woke up to drilling and hammering. And although they moved us once, it didn't fix the issue. I just felt that we should have been offered some compensation for that from the manager other than a free breakfast one day. Also, we were on Starpoints and although we booked months in advance and requested a view room--we did not receive that. We found after 3 Westin stays in Europe that it seems the Europeans get the view rooms and there is some mild bias against Americans still. The other issue that really bothered us was that normallky breakfast was not included (even though we were spending 12,000 points per night) and it was 57 EURO (about 80US) each person for a very simple buffet breakfast! We just don't think that it's smart for a hotel to insult us with such pricing. And there wasn't any coffee available. So we had to go up the street to get croissants and coffee for 5E or so. This hotel is close to being a 5 star, but there were too many "issues" to make it that. They tout all the stars that stay in the penthouse, but what about the rest of us??

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and elegant experience!”
Reviews.Author: MarakiOttawa
Reviews.Content: Hotel Eden was an absolute beautiful hotel in a great location. As soon as we arrived, they upgraded us to a marvelous 2 bedroom suite; we did not want to leave the room! Beautiful roof-top restaurant/bar with a marvelous view of Rome. I would highly recommend staying here if you want luxury!

Reviews.Title: “First class.”
Reviews.Author: newyorker020
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel, the room was gorgeous and the location is great. Single rooms are really single rooms, full bed but small closet... did not bother me, but you could not unpack a large suitcase into that closet. Immediate neighborhood much nicer than the Hotel Grand. Have a drink on the terrace bar. The view is spectacular and staff outstanding. Concierge was nice, more businesslike than Hotel Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: dina4
Reviews.Content: Lovely, quiet boutique hotel. We were upgraded to a suite (starwood members), and our kids had a standard room next door. Both were very comfortable and luxurious. We didn't eat at the restaurants, but we had drinks twice in the rooftop bar -- a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, perfect service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Katy1, TX
Reviews.Content: I felt very welcome and attended to while at Hotel Eden. The staff was friendly, attentive and went that extra mile. The rooms were exquisite. The location is fantastic! Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay at Hotel Eden”
Reviews.Author: islandhopper21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights in June 2009. We used starpoints to pay for the room. We found it cute and elegant but not WOW. After a long travel day and jet lagged, we were woken up at 12:30am by a garbage truck that lasted for over 30 minutes and couldn't go back to sleep until 5am. We were facing the rear of the hotel. Not a bad location, just if you need to sleep after a long travel day. I think the hotel had better rooms for 20K starpoints a night but we weren't presented with anything better and I don't like to beg, being a gold member starwood hotels always mention that I received a free upgrade but this one didn't. The concierge and front desk were fine. I will mention I slipped in the bathtub and the luckily the shower curtain saved me from certain serious injury. Its a small tub curved sharply on both sides so you have to try and balance on one leg while showering. The location is perfect and the best feature. Some nice restaurants nearby and the Spanish steps and Trevi Fountain are within 10 min walking distance. It was a nice finale to our two nights in Rome. I will also mention that the internet is ok. We ended up using their business center which consists of two old computers. It was fine for our use but for a hotel of this stature and the price, they could do better. The wi-fi in the lobby wasn't working for us either. No internet from the room which is also not good since many of the starwood luxury and Le Meridien hotels have nice systems. The bed was not good and the linen was scratchy. The Superior room was small located on the 4th floor. The hotel is elegant but I didn't feel funny wearing jeans and nice shirt when others were wearing gowns and suits. I would stay here again but ask for a room facing a different street. This part of Rome is awesome and Romantic. Their restaurant on the 6th floor is a must. We spent a nice hour at their lounge with live piano and singing, taking in the beautiful view at night with a couple of drinks, for 24 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rooms, Location and Service- Sumptious European Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Where2Next4
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at Hotel Eden, and thanks to Trip Advisor reviews, knew what to expect. This was a great location for our plans, convenient to the Spanish Steps and Piazza Barberini metro station (about 2 blocks away). We had 2 children with us, and the staff was quite friendly and helpful. The concierge helped us with reservations for several things, and directions as well. The room was spacious, and had a separate shower and tub, which was great with the kids. The water was plentiful with great pressure/rain shower. The furnishings were rather sumptious, as to be expected in a hotel of this level. The windows opened for lovely night air, and we had parquet floors, a loveseat, desk, small table, a few chairs, and several windowseats. We had an in room safe, and a small mini bar (could remove a few drinks to place your own items inside with no problem). The bed was not as hard as I was expecting, but was not as comfortable as the fluffy heavenly bed you might see at other starwood hotels stateside. We had nightly turn down service with chocolates or candy delivered- the kids loved that touch! The only drawback I saw has nothing to do with the hotel but with European hotel style in general when traveling with kids- you need to be prepared for only one bed. They will bring in one cot, if that is what you prefer for the kids, and there was plenty of space for that in our room. If you are using starwood points, as we were, you can upgrade your room to a more appropriate one for children. Call the hotel and discuss with them in advance. Per the previous reviews, we did not eat at the hotel for breakfast or order room service (extremely expensive) but did shell out the 23 euro to use the internet for 24 hours in the room. We didn't find any hotels during our stay that included internet- seems to be a European thing. We had a rental car for use during other parts of our trip, and conveniently parked it right across the street in the garage for 18 euro a night- this is one of the few parking garages we saw in Rome, so the location was excellent for that. My husband thought this would have been incredible as a romantic destination for 2 adults. Overall, we thought it was great, but you could probably find other better values if that is what you need in Rome- for our starwood points it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Luxurious but very expensive and not for kids”
Reviews.Author: chicagomomIllinois
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed by the beautiful lobby, and the rooms met the highest standards of taste and luxury. This is a gorgeous hotel and unlike other "grand dames" does not feel the slightest bit shabby or worn - it's top notch in every respect. I would agree with the comments of others that the service was a bit snooty - I felt like they checked us in and then virtually ignored us apart from a mumbled buona sera when we were walking in/out. I liked the location, especially in the spring when we wanted to spend time in the Villa Borghese gardens. Reasonable walk to metro and lots of interesting locations. The breakfast is great - but it cost 53 Euros. On the first day I assumed/hoped that they were not charging me the 53 for each of my children (ages 4 and 6) who ate about one bite of toast and a sip of juice apiece. The second day, before heading to the restaurant, I phoned the restaurant as well as the concierge who assured me that yes, the children were charged 53 euros too! For me and two children, breakfast cost about US$200. It was perfectly lovely and delicious, but not worth that much. Internet cost 23 EUR per day or 0.60 per minute. Laundry prices were very high as well. All-in-all, this is a great hotel and it's hard to find any issues with the comfort level, but the price (of the room as well as each and every one of the extras) is sky high, even for what it is. No value here.

Reviews.Title: “It's not all that!”
Reviews.Author: ahfun123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from March 20 to 24. We decided to take the Leonardo Express to get to the hotel. The cost for both of us was 24euro from the airport. I regret taking the train because the train was slow and after we got off the train, we had a hard time finding the hotel. We got off at Barberini station and it was about 5-7mins walk (a little bit uphill and streets were narrow). I believe the Spagna station has a little bit oh uphill too. With all of the hassles that we went thru, we should have went with the $40euro private taxi. The checkin was fast and easy. We got a room at the first floor near the corner. When we open the window, the dumpster was right there. Of course, it had a bad smell. We reserved a double room and that room had a fullsize bed which i thought it was small for both of us but the bathroom was nice and spacious. The second day our bathroom broke. It wouldnt flush. They wouldnt switch the room because they said it was all booked. This problem continued for the next 2 days. They tried to fix it but couldnt. So we were stuck with the broken toilet. Until the last day, they moved us to 4th floor with balcony. This room was better with queen size bed. The rooftop restaurant was nice, had a nice view but expensive. The checkout was quick. This time we took the private taxi to Termini station. It was $10euro.

Reviews.Title: “The Eden is Reliable Luxury”
Reviews.Author: sharoosie
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Eden two weeks ago. The staff was lovely. The rooms we were given were spacious and beautifully decorated. This is a hotel with real old world charm. Its location is superb, just two blocks from the Spanish Steps and a lovely walk from the Trevi Fountain area. I look forward to returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: texasgirl568
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Eden in October during a trip to Rome to celebrate my 40th birthday. We had just come from the Four Seasons in Florence which was spectacular. Sadly it was a let-down to arrive at the Eden. The staff was nice upon our arrival but not overly friendly. The room we booked was very small and the bathroom was absolutely tiny. The decor was dated and the bed was not comfortable. I will say the rooftop bar and restaurant have extraordinary views of the city. But that's the only nice thing I can think of about this hotel. We also didn't like the location -- I felt like we were staying in the business district which was not at all charming. We stayed before at the Hotel Minerva which we think is in a much better location (very near the Pantheon), has a much nicer and friendlier staff and bigger rooms -- all for 200 euros less a night. If you are looking for a luxury hotel during your stay in Rome -- this hotel is not it! Next time we will stay at the Minerva again or maybe try the Hassler.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful grand old hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dantescraps2007
Reviews.Content: I must admit, this is the first hotel that we did not book in accordance with Trip Advisor, but I'm glad that was the case. Some of the reviews for the hotel were a little bit negative, but we had an excellent experience at the Hotel Eden. It is a pricey place but you get what you pay for. Our room was immaculately clean and had a wonderful view of the street and window access to a terrace where there were tables and chairs set for sunbathing. The bathroom was large and spacious and we still rave about the shower being one of the best hotel showers we've experienced in Europe. The staff were extremely helpful and tended to our every whim and concern, which, although to be expected at this price point, doesn't always occur in other hotels of equal calibre. We participated in formal afternoon tea twice while we were there--a wonderful experience in front of the fire, especially given the cold spell that descended on Rome that week--and had dinner in the terrace restaurant once. Even if you don't stay at this hotel, be sure to eat at the restaurant. It is worthy of its reputation. The location of the hotel was excellent, only 10 minutes' walk from the Spanish Steps, the Pantheon, and the Trevi Fountain. There are also a number of wonderful little restaurants and gelaterias close by. All in all, give this grand old hotel a chance. You could find more modern accomodations, but you are unlikely to find the charm or level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Eden - I wouldn't think of staying anywhere else!!”
Reviews.Author: BobRen62
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at The Eden for more than a decade, for both for business and pleasure. Each time I leave makes me want to return even more. The size of the hotel is perfect: smaller than a little boutique, but nowehere near large enough to feel like a big hotel. The location is nothing short of perfect as well. A five minute walk to the Spanish Steps, the Via Veneto, or Piazza Barberini. and it is extremely tastefully decorated. It's like staying in a private villa. Very elegant, yet very comfortable. What makes the hotel very special however, is the staff. Starting with the hotel general manager, Marcel Levy, and right on down, they are the top of the list as far as service and giving attention. We have a nearly four year old (this was his second visit to the Eden), and the staff in the hotel, in particular the breakfast room, made him feel like The Principe during our entire stay. Their personal attention, enthusatically offered, is why I keep going back. Same with the bar staff in the elegant roof top lounge -- offering one of the best views in Rome. They are all superb. There are always little things that could be better -- for instance having to ask for a room upgrade as a Platinum member when the hotel was pretty empty pre-Christmas. No need for that really, especially since I was paying a pretty good rate, not staying on points. But I chalk that up to the exception to the rule. This is a first class hotel run by incredibly professional, welcoming people. I doubt I'll ever stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Snooty but great location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: Anne_from_Ohio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Eden for one night using travel points and prior to starting a cruise. The hotel is gorgeous and has rightly earned all of the acclaim. the location is great, just above the Spanish Steps, not far from Embassy Row, and near the Borghese Gallery. The staff are preposterously snooty. We tend to travel very lightly, so we do not take much and we most certainly leave anything expensive at home. The staff interpreted our choices as being lower class and treated us with a rudeness that was quite blatant. It was worth putting up with since everything else was terrific. In fact, it was rather amusing, so we started playing up to it just for laughs. Oh, and they give you a give of local honey. What a stupid gift for travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but overrated”
Reviews.Author: IHeartTravel193
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights this past summer on holiday and was expecting a lot more from this hotel after reading all the reviews and based on their rates. The hotel feels a bit old and dated, and outside of the spectacular views from La Terrazza Bar, it's not very special. For the amount of money they charge, they definitely did not deliver.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: IG_from_Boston
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Hotel Eden in Rome, and were pampered the entire time. The service is impeccable, the views spectacular, the location wonderful. This hotel is steps away from all the sights of Rome (i.e., the Spanish Steps are a 5 minute walk), yet its proximity to Villa Borghese makes it seem like a relaxing oasis in the crowded hustle and bustle of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the rooftop even if you aren't staying at the Eden”
Reviews.Author: TMeric2
Reviews.Content: The Eden rooftop is a great for a panoramic view of the city. Definitely a place to watch the sunset and enjoy a cocktail in style--without the big expense of a room for the night. **Note that men must wear long pants after 6pm or they won't be allowed on the rooftop.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate luxury”
Reviews.Author: BobfromNYC
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in the heart of Rome. We dreamt about going to Rome and I must say that the Eden is heaven. We had a great stay in a lovely room. Staff is very professional. Breakfast room is amazing overlooking the entire city. Hotel Eden is impressive and a must for your next holiday in Rome (if you can afford it).

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: HeavyTraveller73
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hotel Eden for three times over the last three years. Hotel is close to perfection. Especially the level of service is amazing yet not being too posh. Definitely a place to stay when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot go wrong with the Eden...”
Reviews.Author: AhoyPaloi19
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a recent stay at the Hotel Eden. Also stayed at the Westin Excelsior during the same week. Must say that while the Westin is much larger and seems to have received a more recent update, the intimacy, and attention that you receive at the Hotel Eden make this the better choice in Rome. From the moment we checked in we were given the utmost attention from the staff, and as a Starwood Platinum member I was immediately given an upgraded room. The rooms have more character than the Westin, along with some great views of the Villa Borghese next door. While drinks at the hotel bar might be expensive there isn't a better view of St. Peter's Basilica at night. If I had to find one fault with this hotel it would be in the recommendation given for dinner on a Sunday night in Rome. The recommendation wasn't great, but again this is the only fault I found.

Reviews.Title: “No need to pay more”
Reviews.Author: colnagogirl339
Reviews.Content: There are more expensive hotels in Rome, but I don't know what you would be paying for. The location of Hotel Eden is great. The side rooms have great views, overlooking Villa Medici. Very quite and close to Spanish Steps and other sites. Concierge was very helpful in restaurant recommendations and arranging tours ahead of time. The rooms were great and nicely decorated. The twin rooms are slightly larger. The restaurant has a phenominal view, but very expensive. The workout room was small, but had very nice/new equipment with water bottles on hand. I booked this hotel based on other recommendations on this website and was not disappointed. Had considered a number of other hotels that were more expensive and was really glad I did not spend the additional dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: PTD
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay here as a result of reading Trip Advisor. We were very pleased with our decision. Very good location, the rooftop terrace for drinks in the evening and also the place for breakfast were excellent. Staff were very helpful as well. Would stop there again. Rooms and all bed all good.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of Calm”
Reviews.Author: purdueup
Reviews.Content: We initially had a problem when we checked in. We had booked this hotel thru the Starwood (SPG) guest website and chose it by it's reputation and location. We booked the hotel for 3 guests, when we arrived they were shocked to discover that we were a party of three, this threw them into a frenzy and they implied that we were mistaken. They finally agreed to supply us with a rollaway bed at an additional charge of 140 Euro per day, bringing the total cost to 600 Euros per day. The website should inform you that their rooms are not of a size that can accommodate three guests and that there will be an additional charge. Otherwise the hotel and it's service level were wonderful, the location is on a very quiet calm street which is nice in this bustling city. In retrospect we felt that the hotel was a little old fashioned and located in an area that may have been popular at one time but not anymore. We returned to Rome at the end of our trip and stayed in a different area of the city near the Via Condotti and found it much more lively and interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaBender
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a total of 4 nights. Nothing was a problem. The staff was so accomodating one felt as if they were leaving family. The site is perfect near the via veneto yet no crowds. The rooms are clean,classic, and yet have modern ammenities. Expensive but well worth it. Once you stay here in Rome you may find it hard to stay anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “Nice but outrageously expensive”
Reviews.Author: rua25
Reviews.Content: Hotel Eden is a nice clean pleasant hotel with friendly staff however it is very expensive for what you get. We stayed 6 nights at 380euro/night not including breakfast. Concierge very helpful. However breakfast 58 euros a head, internet in roon 60cents a minute!! and minibar and roomservice outrageous, a small tobelerone from minibar 8 EUROS!!! We didnt mind paying for a comfortable stay in rome and had a great trip but room was small enough. Have paid less for far more superior 5 star hotels, would rate this hotel as 4 star and expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Very Discreet”
Reviews.Author: carolynLondon
Reviews.Content: A stay at Hotel Eden can set you back a fortune and I am still wondering was it worth it. We really noticed the small discreet additional things like every time you left your room, maids would rush in and tidy up, or leave chocolates on your pillows, change towels again, hang your clothes up. We never saw them, only sensed them which is the sign of a good hotel. The bar/restaurant at the top of the hotel has very nice views although most tables and chairs face inwards so it was difficult to make full use of this advantage. The breakfast must be the most expensive in the world - Euros 53 per person! We never actually braved such expense. Rooms were huge, very quiet, airy, lovely bathrooms with bath, all of which are unusual in Rome which was why we chose it. So def. worth it on this score. The concierge was very helpful and provide great unbiased recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Small Hotel - Top Service”
Reviews.Author: lsalazarg
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel thru luxurylink dot com and got 50% off from regular fares. The service was probably the best service we got in our 8 weeks vacation traveling Italy last summer. We got there too early (8 am) and the staff took our luggage, took care of the car, took us to a complimentary breakfast at the wonderful restaurant at the top floor, overlooking Rome. Probably the best breakfast in Italy after the Palazzo in Venice. Since we were a bit tired and I guess they could see that, they gave us the key to a very small room, but good enough to take a shower and take a nap. When our room was ready we were upgraded to a suite. The concierge service was superb, taking care of everything: tips on how to avoid long lines at local attractions, best family style restaurant, finding for us one olive oil we were looking for, taking care of our car for free (who needs a car in Rome after all) and also offered me superb assistance with a dental emergency I had. They even followed up with me and the Dr. after my appointment. I would never consider another hotel when visiting Rome, my wife and our 10 yrs old were delighted, location is great and you can walk almost everywhere: Via Veneto, Piazza Spagna... etc. It is a very small hotel, therefore the staff gets to know you well. We had a fantastic view from our room, but the street is noisy early in the morning with the garbage recollection and street cleaning, it was not a problem for us, but if that could be an issue, ask for one room looking at the internal gardens. Also if you send a fax in advance with your trip details, how long are you staying, purpose of your trip (family vacation, business, honeymoon, etc) if in Italian, even better, the concierge can take care of making your stay even more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Great Concierge but Some Problems”
Reviews.Author: tabby_travels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Eden Rome for 2 nights. It met our expectations for a Roman hotel in this price range except that the cost of breakfast from room service or in the restaurant is outrageously expensive for some reason and definitely not worth it. You'd be much better off wandering around the neighbourhood and taking breakfast at one of the many little authentic cafes near the hotel instead. We can highly recommend the Cafe Greco. Their cafe latte is a definite must! The hotel is located in the downtown core, close to the Spanish Steps and is nicely situated on top of a little hill giving it great views of Rome's skyline. Our room on the 4th floor faced the front of the hotel so in addition to the skyline views we saw some beautiful sunsets too. The room had a high ceiling and had tasteful, but not elaborate, muted furnishings, all in good condition. However, there were two problems with the room: 1. the thermostat was not working properly so even though we set it at 20 degrees celsius, by the middle of the night our room was like a sauna. We opened the windows for some fresh air but the second problem we discovered with the room was the noise: at 3:00AM there were garbage trucks emptying bottles from bins! Also making noise day and night were groups of tourists waiting for tour buses to arrive on the opposite side of the street in front of the hotel. There was also continuous noise from cars and people entering and leaving a popular public parking garage. The problem is that the front of the hotel seems to have the best views so you need to chose between noise or a good view. The public areas in the hotel were nice. The lobby was beautifully furnished and well maintained and they serve afternoon tea on an upper level. The concierge was really on the ball and he was very helpful for securing reservations and providing general information. The bar and restaurant on the top floor has amazing views - especially at night when some of the neighbouring heritage buildings are illuminated. We dined in the hotel restaurant one night and enjoyed it. The food was good and varied and the wine list (mostly Italian) was varied with acceptable prices. All in all we'd stay there again but we'd definitely request a quieter room.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Introduction to the Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: CabFranc
Reviews.Content: We arrived just before noon and were graciously checked in hours before the hotel's standard time. Exhausted from 24 hours of travel, we were still awed when we saw our room: antique furnishings, a canopied 4-poster, generous storage, flat screen TV, desk, sitting area and large, marble-tiled bathroom with towel heater, tub/shower combo, Hermes toiletries, a bidet and two sinks. Two sets of French windows opened onto a flower-filled courtyard. There was no hint of the hustle and bustle of the city outside, even during a transportation strike that clogged Rome's streets with honking cars and scooters. The bed was a cloud of crisp, smooth, linens, down comforter and four heavenly pillows. It was worlds away from American luxury hotels, even though it's part of the Starwood group, and the perfect introduction to a European holiday. The rooftop bar was elegant with views to die for, and staff made us feel welcome and relaxed when we visited early afternoon in our casual sightseeing clothes. For a special getaway, when cost is irrelevant, the Eden cannot be matched.

Reviews.Title: “new year in the eden”
Reviews.Author: jonnym
Reviews.Content: my wife and i have just some back from a 5 night break over new year to the eden hotel in rome. overall, we had a lovely experience in rome and the eden is a classically luxurious hotel, boasting a grand history of hosting celebrities such as Tom Cruise, politicians etc. Overall here are a list of positives and negatives POSITIVES great location- 5 min walk to spanish steps and via veneto Nice rooms- very warm given the january cold and nicely furnished lovely breakfast in top floor restaurant- great views over rome good concierge- esp guy with brown hair, others a bit mixed New yr's eve in the bar- views of fireworks all over rome for 20 miles- amazing! NEGATIVES very expensive for drinks and restaurant obscenely expensive, even for a 2star rest 850 euros per person for new years eve- indeed all of rome a rip off charge of internet use- already paying top dollar for staying there not much there apart from rooms, no sauna etc some concierge recommendations a bit dodgy Bar very expensive Overall visited other 5 stars for drinks- westin did not seem that great- felt too big, more expensive and not worth it, prefered eden. Hassler bar was very old and needed facelift but even better location than eden. The eden is the grand dame of hotels iin rome so great to stay there- just dont expect it to be the best ever hotel you have stayed in although it has been voted best hotel in europe 2007!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Dame Hotel Needs More Updating”
Reviews.Author: ccgworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here during the Christmas holidays. Location is great - within short walking distance of the Spanish Steps, Villa Borghese Gardens, Fountain of Trevi and much more! Closest subway stop is on the A Line at the Barberini stop (which is the foot of the Via Veneto). Hotel recently underwent some renovations to the rooms from what I can tell. I am a platinum with Starwood and since this is a Starwood property (part of the Meridien Hotel group) I am entitled to a room upgrade if available. Beware - i was given an "upgrade" to a shabby room, not much larger, had not been one of the renovated rooms... and the hotel acted like it was a nicer room. I called and had us moved to a room with more light, two windows, and a renovated room. Although it was in my original room class (deluxe) it was FAR better than the "upgraded" studio room. Pls make sure you get a renovated room if you check in here. The hotel is a bit "old" feeling for my taste and I would probably not stay there again. The doormen and bell staff didnt seem very attentive or helpful - they were rarely there to even open the heavy doors... Also beware that wi-fi service here costs 23 Euros for 24 hours - that is way higher than most hotels. One other note - the hot water pipe broke on one morning and there was no hot water for showers for many hours... not good on a cold winter morning. No letter or announcement was sent around to guest rooms until late in the day after it had been resolved - seems backwards in my book in terms of being proactive on service quality -- as soon as there is a problem like this, the hotel should have notified all guests by short note under the door immediately. On a bright note, the rooftop terrace bar was amazing in terms of views and service. the public lobby areas were also nice, including the fireplace sitting room.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves its reward of best hotel in Europe”
Reviews.Author: bchiarut
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel directly. Great hotel and excellent service. The rooftop bar and restaurant offers an impressive view over Rome. Highly recommend this very well managed hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tasteful elegance”
Reviews.Author: ATourist2day
Reviews.Content: The service here was excellent. We were upgraded to a junior suite because we were Starwood Hotel Group members. The suite had a impressive marble foyer, a decent sized bedroom, a marble bath with awsome water pressure and a separate sitting room. We were on the forth floor facing the front. We had three large windows with nice views of the city. The only flaw I noticed was some wear (scratches) on the woodwork od the cabinet hold the flat panel TV and minibar. For 2060 euros a night you'd think that kind of thing would be taken care of promptly. But otherwise a flawless 4 night stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, too pricey”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelers4106
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Rome for business with some time for sightseeing, and stayed at the Hotel Eden. I found the location to be incredible. It is literally a short walk away from the spanish steps, the trevi foundation and multiple metro stops. I found the concierge to be incredibly helpful and friendly. They really went out of their way to be honest about meals, transportation and tours. The room was plush and a decent size. The bathroom was very clean with lots of extra towels. The only drawbacks to this hotel...very noisy. I heard every door banging, every person in the hallway and our neighbors. Also, I was able to get a government rate, but if I had to pay the full rate, I would not have thought it was worth it. If you're willing to pay a little more for location and helpful staff, this is the right hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Palace in the Middle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Mark_in_Durham
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Eden for three nights as part of a sojourn throughout Italy. It was our first stop and we were looking for something within walking distance of major sites and activities, but also quite and comfortable--a place to relax after a long flight. The Eden fit this bill exactly. Service was gracious and formal, but not stuffy. We made use of many services, including dry cleaning, and everything was prompt and perfect. The hotel was nearly full, but we rarely saw or heard another guest outside of La Terraza, the rooftop restaurant. The food and view were exceptional, as was the cost--one of the most expensive meals I've ever purchased. The room was luxurious and had all the amenities expected of a 5 star property, but it was on the small side. This was not unexpected for Rome. Hotel Eden, however, is not cheap, and while I recommend it highly, I think comparable experiences might be found at bed and breakfasts and other lodging for less money. In fact, we alternated between 5 star hotels and B&Bs throughout Italy and found many B&Bs that, while lacking some cache, matched the hotels in amenities and comfort for much less money.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay ...”
Reviews.Author: dora_pirate
Reviews.Content: The hotel was elegant and serviceable. It was pricey, but I was looking for something a bit more 'standard' as my husband and I had brought his mother along with us for her very first international trip. The rooms were small but quiet and the location was great. The truth of Rome is that you just really ought to take a taxi to most places ... The rooftop breakfasts were divine and we had a lovely dinner up there one night as well. The staff were helpful but not obsequious which was nice and the concierge was very helpful. I would recommend this to Americans traveling abroad that are inexperienced or have little tolerance for deviation from American ways, but I would not pick this hotel again for just my husband and I ... not because anything was lacking ... just because I'd prefer a more 'hip' atmosphere. I stayed at Hotel Lungarno in Florence which is part of a mini-chain started by Ferragamo ... and they have a hotel in Rome that I would probably try on my next visit. I would like to say one more time, however, that the rooftop restaurant for breakfast, dinner and drinks was FANTASTIC.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey Palace”
Reviews.Author: Leisureboy
Reviews.Content: Very expensive hotel with terrific views and location, tucked off a discreet street corner. Elegant styling with fine antiques. Tiny elevators. Room boasted high ceilings, bold mouldings, dramatic draperies and chandelier. Large marble bath with poor wattage vintage lighting and narrow vintage tub that was an uncomfortable shower for two. Equally expensive restaurant (95 Euros for wine and appetizer) but uncompromised views of Rome. Staff were refined and attentive. There are many lovely and less pricey accomodations in Rome with a hotel, church and gelateria at nearly every block.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Superb!”
Reviews.Author: WDWDolphinFan
Reviews.Content: We loved our 5-night stay at The Eden. This is truly a superb luxury hotel. Our room was one of the larger rooms, and was very spacious and elegant. The marble bathroom was huge and very nice, with luxurious towels, robes, linens and amenities. Everything was absolutely top-notch. Had we been on a higher floor (we were on the 2nd floor), we would have had great views over gardens, to church domes and other sights of Rome. As it was, we could see palm trees and other greenery, and the twin towers of the Trinita dei Monte at the top of Spanish Steps. (Be sure to reserve an exterior-view room. The interior view is not so appealing.) The hotel's location beside gardens and in a quiet area of beautiful, elegant buildings and greenery was excellent, and was a welcome respite from the traffic and concrete of the city. Most mornings, we walked about 2 blocks down the tree-lined and relatively quiet street to a small bar for coffee and chocolate-filled croissants for breakfast. This elegant and peaceful setting in such a bustling city really made a difference in our stay. Yet we were less than a 10-minute walk to the top of the Spanish Steps, and within easy walking distance to the Borghese Galleries and the Trevi Fountain. The service was outstanding, from everyone we encountered. After only one day, the doormen recognized us, and consistently greeted us warmly. The concierge's restaurant recommendations were very good, and in line with the price range of other restaurants we inquired about. We were made to feel like welcome guests each time we entered the hotel. The hotel had a smaller, more intimate feel than most large luxury hotels, which enhanced our stay. We enjoyed cocktails on the rooftop terrace at sunset one night, with a wonderful view of Rome, including the dome of St. Peters. This was my third trip to Rome, each time staying in one of the top-ranked hotels, and the Eden was by far the best! We would be delighted to return to the Eden.

Reviews.Title: “A superb luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clutz7777
Reviews.Content: I booked the Eden for a two night stay in September as part of my wifes 30th birthday celebrations. I cannot fault the service, location or rooms - we had a fantastic 5th floor corner room (504 I think) with a balcony, entrance lobby, walk in wardrobe and splendid views over Rome. As with other reviewers, having arrived before our room was ready we were escorted to the roof top terrace for complimentary drinks - Vintage Krug champagne went down rather well as a start to our break. The head concierge, a vital part of a well run establishment, was courteous, charming and efficient and recommended two superb restaurants during our stay, one tucked away in a back street for a light lunch which was exactly what I had requested. We dined in the Eden restaurant on the first night and had a splendid meal; having had an early start to the day we had crashed out in the room at 5pm and were woken by a call from reception at 7pm gently "reminding" us of our dinner reservation, my wife thinks she vaguely remembers housekeeping trying to come in for turn down and we are sure that they told reception that we might need a little nudge awake!. As part of our first visit to Rome, I wanted to walk around the city with a guide to show us the sights and the hotel organised this as requested - I would recommend this to anyone (guide was called John and made the trip for us). Yes the hotel is expensive - Rome in general is expensive, I paid €40 for a beer, two coffees and a sandwich, but was in a cafe overlooking the Colosseum at the time. I would most definitely recommend the Hotel Eden for anyone looking for a special place to stay in Rome, and would urge you to visit Rome if you have not already done so

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service!”
Reviews.Author: KCS_Marketing
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I spent three nights at the Hotel Eden at the tail end of a longer trip to several other locations in Italy. We found it to be a really wonderful, relaxing experience, mostly because of the personal and expert service. Some examples: - When we arrived a bit before the usual check-in time, we were greeted warmly and offered complimentary cocktails in the lovely rooftop bar as we waited. - Turn-down service was nicely done, and housekeeping seemed to have tidied up the room at least twice a day, including fresh towels. - We had a minor problem with the plumbing. When I called for service, it was offered immediately. The repair was completed within 20 minutes of my call. - I lost an earring in a taxi... The hotel doorman dug around under the seats of the taxi with the driver until they found it. Neither would accept a tip. - The concierge was very helpful. We were happy with our dinner recommendations, and one restaurant was really outstanding. - The rooftop bar was a great place to relax. Drinks come with a selection of various snacks, one of which was pistachio nuts. My husband loves them, and ate them all on our first visit to the bar. After that, every time we stopped for a drink, they brought him a big bowl of pistachios. They remembered he likes them. Yeah... I read all the other comments from people who found the Hotel Eden to be a bit expensive. It is pricey, but I wanted to share our experience, which explains the kind of treatment we got at this lovely hotel. For us, we wanted a respite from all the touristy crowds in Roma, and the Eden was a great place to be treated as a valued guest, rather than just another tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Very Expensive!”
Reviews.Author: brads5
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Eden in Rome is a lovely Hotel in a beautiful location but we certainly did not feel that it was worth what they charge. We were glad that we used Starpoints for the room. We did, however, have dinner in the 6th floor restaurant and brunch in the adjoining bar. We had read wonderful reviews about the hotel and restaurant but perhaps the chef has changed since the review was written? Our dining experience was a major disappointment. The presentation of the food, the selection on the menu, and the prices were very disappointing. We did enjoy the wine and the small pastries. We had 2 drinks and shared a fruit platter (very good) for brunch (a little more than $80). The room was beautiful and comfortable - a welcome retreat from the heat of Rome. The staff was friendly, the concierge was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: BeauBeauDesMoines
Reviews.Content: The location was right next to the Spanish Steps and 2 blocks from the Via Veneto. The Via Veneto was mainly eating and not much shopping. You have to walk up the Spanish Steps to get to the hotel after shopping. Not easy. The hotel was very stuffy and the staff not very helpful. After asking if a certain restaurant was in a safe area they allowed 2 single women to get in a cab with a driver who spoke no English. He drove us out of the heart of Rome onto dark empty streets and couldn't find the restaurant, then started yelling at us until we could finally convey to him we wanted to go back to our hotel. Very scary! When we told the conciege we hardly got an apology. The concieges were not what I would have expected at a 5 star hotel. Our room was located right next to the elevators and definitely a disapointment. Make sure you know what room you are getting before you have you luggage delivered!!! They had great rooms, we just did not get one. Wish we had stayed at the Westin Excelsior. Would never stay at the Hotel Eden again while in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- great location”
Reviews.Author: FloridaMember
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Eden June 2007. Loved the hotel and the lcoation. It was within walking distance to most of Rome. It's up a hill away from the noise of the city. The room was clean and comfortable and the concierge was very helpful. The only complaint that I have is that it is VERY expensive. If you could get a great rate, or don't mind spending, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “stay here if you're a masochist”
Reviews.Author: santamonicagal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the storied Eden for three nights. We felt like the hotel fleeced and abused us. Considering what we paid, we had expected first-class service with commensurate amenities. Here's what we got instead: - The hotel concierge was irresponsible and utterly useless. He was brusque, sent us to a wrong location for a purchase (wasting about 1/2 hour of time) and told us wrong information about the Borghese Gallery (wasting another 1/2 hour of our time). - The hotel has a gym. Stay away from it -- it is dangerous. In the 19 years since I began working out regularly with weights, I've never been injured -- until my encounter with the weight machines at the Eden. Several are seriously miscalibrated, with uneven tension. The Eden machines caused me to suffer a painful strain. - Poor value: Our reservation was inadvertently booked for just one person (it might have been our error), so the hotel asked us to pay a "supplement" (about $140) because we are two people. No problem. But hotels that do that typically provide something of value for the extra money, such as an extra bed, or in the case of a couple, a larger or more comfortable room. Not so at the Eden. We got the same tiny room for a single person (among the smallest, according to the hotel's own floor plan), with a bathroom so cramped that my husband and I could not both be in there at the same time. The bathroom door slams into the toilet if you open it too wide. There was barely closet space for one (and we traveled only with carry-on bags). - Annoying nickel and diming: We made several long collect and toll-free calls from the hotel phone to report lost credit cards. We were told there would be a phone "connection charge." Of course. But the "connection charge" is not a small one-time fee, it turned out. The Eden charges you for the *entire duration* of your call, even if you use a calling card. Our final phone bills were shocking. - A certain coldness and attitude among the front-desk staff and concierge that was a bit unnecessary and frankly, off-putting. I honestly think they try to make some of their guests feel like they are nobodies, which they probably thought we were. If they only knew.... What we liked about the Eden: - Old World charm (but we could have gotten that at many hotels in Rome), meticulously restored. - An amazing combination of shutters and black-out curtains on our window. Our room remained completely dark even when it was a sunny outside, so we slept really well until almost noon every day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Service and Product”
Reviews.Author: zackhb
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights (14 & 15 April) and all the service staff that we came into contact from check in to check out were very profesional and helpful. The location is perfect if you are tourist as most sightseeing location are within walking distance. We walk to all the historical sight, except the Vatican. The bedroom and bathroom size and cleanliness are very good. After you close the double glaze windows, you don't hear any street noise. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom amenities are of 5 star standard (Penhaligons). The marble bathroom is quite big but the bathtub size is a bit smaller than regular bathtub. The menu prices are quite on the expensive side. I would definately recommend this hotel and come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Leave with a lighter wallet”
Reviews.Author: zswaps
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights at the end of March. There is no doubt that this hotel leaves one's wallet much lighter by the end of the visit. I found the service to be very good and the rooms were well-appointed and comfortable. But there is nothing that is "value" in this hotel, down to the EUR 6 for the small bottle of water in the mini-bar. The hotel's location can't be beat, but there are definitely places to go for better value and equivalent amenities. But despite the prices, a drink in La Terrasse (sp?) bar on the 6th floor at sunset is a MUST.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service in a 1st Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrishTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in the wonderful Hotel Eden with my wife and my parents. For those who have remarked in previous reviews about the aloof, elitest and snobbish attitude of the staff, I can only suggest that perhaps you received service that reflected your own personalities. I simply can't speak highly enough about the welcome that we received upon arrival and this theme continued throughout our stay. Warm, friendly, accommodating, professional, efficient.... I could go on forever! Also take into consideration that we were staying there on a special "Starwood STARHOT" rate reserved for Starwood staff members (my wife) and so we paid considerably less. This had no bearing whatsoever on the treatment that we received from the staff. Old world charm and ceremony abounds and one really feels that they are living in the luxuriant lap of some bygone era. Now, to say that The Eden is in the norm expensive is an understatement of the highest order; usually a room will set you back in the vicinity of 700 Euro per night but remember that this is an hotel that markets itself toward the rich and famous, politicians and high-end executive types. That said, 8 Euro for a Snickers from the minibar is simply taking the mickey... A continental breakfast for 1 with coffee, 4 pastries and juice was 30 Euro plus 6.50 for room service delivery. Full English breakfast was 50 Euro plus delivery per person A mini can of Coke from the minibar was 8 Euro.... Suffice it to say that by any standard these are outrageous prices but again, remember that usually they are dealing with customers for whom the price is not a factor. In terms of the accommodation, elegant and simple period decor is in evidence everywhere and while the run of the mill rooms are not jaw droppingly gorgeous, they are spacious and comfortable. Bathrooms are large with marble floors and features, and enough goodies to open your own beauty parlour. Housekeeping come in during the evening to turn down the bed, leave a little chocolate treat alongside the following days' weather forecast, fix up the room and bathroom, lay out your slippers and jim-jams and generally make you feel special. To summarise, Hotel Eden is a fabulous example of how an hotel should be run but at the price is only available to the privileged few who can afford it. One could certainly spend less elsewhere and get more for the money but Eden is an experience that I would gladly relive at the drop of a hat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Eden”
Reviews.Author: Traveler714NewYork
Reviews.Content: I wrote this review once before but for some reason it disappeared from the site so I am writing again since I feel like I have to set the record straight after reading all of the other bad reviews for this hotel. The Hotel Eden was great - we actually moved there after checking out of our other hotel which we found to be too small and out of the way. The location can't be beat - the Eden is right by the Spanish Steps, but far enough away so that it is not overcrowded. It is a short walk away from the Villa Borghese, which is so lovely to be close to. The hotel staff was very nice and accommodating - they gave us a free upgrade upon arrival, and were always willing to make reservations for us and made great suggestions of places to see. The room was very lovely and spacious and the bathroom was quite large and posh. We didn't eat a meal at the hotel, but did have drinks at the terrace bar, where the views are amazing and the atmosphere is great. Overall, I would not hesitate to stay at the Eden again. The only downside is the high price, but that's to be expected in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The sheets could have been sand paper”
Reviews.Author: RAZEONE
Reviews.Content: Paid 600 euros a night for a double deluxe room. I would never stay at this hotel again. Granted I have heard that most Hotels in Rome are a bit dated and the rooms are small but this hotel is supposed to be one of the best hotels in all of Rome. The bathroom was so small that my girlfriend and I could not stand in there at the same time. The sheets were so rough that we slept in our bathrobes all three nights. We had to fight with the front desk three times until they gave us our complimentary drinks that were included in our room rate. Rediculous! One positive was the bar and breakfast staff. They were very helpful and accommodating. And yes the view is very nice. However make sure your breakfast is included in the room rate because it costs between 35-50 Euros per person. At 600 Euros a night you can find much better. The only positive was that I received a ton of Starwood points in exchange for getting ripped off. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced, Over Rated, OVER”
Reviews.Author: roberobe
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Eden is very stuffy and very proud of themselves to the point that I am not sure if anyone is really good enough for the staff. We are Plat. Starwood members and had to go through three rooms and threaten to check out ,before we were given a real room that you did not have to leave just to change your mind. The food and drink prices are very very high and the service and food were not great. Three glass's of wine and a cheese plate was $130.00 Two small pots of coffee and three stale rolls where over $90.00 american. When I saw the bill I challenged the poor waiter that there must have been some mistake. I called the room service manager and he told me that was the right price but would be happy to take a few dollars off if that would make me happy. Internet was $35.00 per day. If you just want to say you stayed at the Eden go for it but take lots of cash and drop your standards. I don't mind spending money but I hate being taken! There was one great young blonde lad y behind the desk and a couple of nice doormen. After that, forget it!

Reviews.Title: “Should cost 150 not more”
Reviews.Author: JackHerrer
Reviews.Content: Can only agree with others , Wildly overpriced. This is a 150€ hotel tah for some reason charges 380€ + 49.50 for beaarkfast PER Person. The hotel kas nothing to offer but a decent view from their bar and restaurant. And if you are looking for that view You should better go to Mirabelle at Hotel Splendid up the strreet. NOT worth it. Rooms areaverage.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but over-priced”
Reviews.Author: Altobelli
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 5 nights recently. The Eden is a very stylish boutique hotel that is very well located -5 mins walk to the Spanish Steps and the main shopping area, but far enough away to be quiet. Our room was disappointing - beautifully furnished but very small and over-looked the " courtyard", which as other reviewers have rightly pointed out, is very small which means that you are pracically looking into another bedroom. Service was good. Sampled drinks and food in the Piano Bar - very expensive eg expresso €13, Long Island iced tea €22. Concierge was very helpful and recommended some good restaurants which were not as expensive as the hotel. I have no experience of other hotels in Rome - though I did have a look at the Russie - very modern, stylish and larger hotel. On balance I think I preferred the Eden but as a boutique hotel it lacks a spa and pool etc. Overall it was a very nice hotel but very expensive - this might be just Rome. I have stayed in better hotels in Hong Kong (eg Island Shangri-La or Manhattan eg the Pierre).

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: tapkap
Reviews.Content: this is the 3rd time we have stayed at this hotel and we love it. it's a small boutique hotel with an excellent staff, especially the concierge. we had a room with a marbled foyer, marble bath and nice sized bedroom (room 218). it overlooked the street but was not noisy. our room was immaculate, the bed lines are top notch as are the towels and robes. the view from the roof top restaurant/bar is fabulous at all times of the day and night. the restaurant is okay but I wouldn't eat there. it's very expensive and the food is mediocre. just go up for drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Starwoods property!”
Reviews.Author: imorgan
Reviews.Content: During a recent trip to Italy, our first stop was the Hotel Eden for four nights. Cashed in "molto" Starwoods points for one of their eight Studio rooms and well worth it. Spacious and airy with windows overlooking the surprisingly quiet street in front of the hotel, nicely furnished, and with a beautiful, well-appointed marble bath. We are neither movie stars nor royalty (far from it!) but were treated with the utmost courtesy and hospitality by all the staff. I don't understand some of the other reviews; this was five-star service at its best. Excellent, quiet location, several blocks from the Spanish Steps, which we preferred to being in the middle of the frantic shoppers and other hub-bub in the Spanish Steps area. And, a great base for sight-seeing. The rooftop is actually three areas - the Michelin starred La Terrazza restaurant, the lounge/bar, and the outdoor Il Giardino dell'Eden lounge/restaurant, which we were told was recently glass enclosed for an impressive atrium effect, with large vertical sliding glass windows and awnings to block the overhead sun. We were so captivated by the stunning views over Rome that we became nightly regulars. My husband was able to savor his evening cigar during cocktails, and we enjoyed light dinners from the IL Giardino dell'Eden menu (same kitchen as La Terrazza and OUTSTANDING food), listening to live piano music from the adjacent bar. Watching the sunset, with the balmy evening air wafting in, and watching the lights come on in the city below was a most pleasant way to end a full day of sight-seeing. Ladies, the Concierge booked a hair appt. for me at the Femine Sistina salon, several blocks from the hotel, where Federico gave me one of the best cuts, coloring, and blow-outs I've ever had. I would HIGHLY recommend. Prices typical of any better New York salon. Try Ristorante Villa Tor Carbone "Sora Rosa" for lunch, located at Via Tor carbone, 74. This very local restaurant (we seemed to be surrounded by mostly Italian business people) specializes in fresh seafood, and the waiter treated us to complimentary biscuits and dessert wines after a very reasonably priced and delicious lunch. Back to Hotel Eden, yes, the restaurant is expensive, room service (breakfast) is expensive, but our stay was so very enjoyable in every aspect that we would stay here again in a heartbeat, and in fact can't wait to return. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: aztroon
Reviews.Content: Ok, so at the end of our Italian 3 week holiday, we return to Rome for our last 2 nights. Originally booked to return to St. Regis Grand Hotel Rome, but we decided to stay a little closer to the action (along Via Veneto). The staff attitude is horrible, except for the Concierge. The lobby area of the hotel is beautiful, and for the most part the rooms are nice as well. However, a little small. We had some issues at during check-in, which were addressed by charging us an additional 195 euros to fix the problem. Then, after trying to confirm that breakfast was included in our rate, we were told it was not (however, I found my confirmation which stated otherwise). But had to argue again at check-out for them to fix the bill and remove breakfast. Yes, the hotel's location is great...but it is expensive and really living on the famous history. Hopefully Starwood will get the customer service problem corrected (now that they have bought Le Meridian Hotels).

Reviews.Title: “expensive ,expensive, expensive”
Reviews.Author: COTESIM
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous review in terms of location and the stunning views across Rome from the 6th floor restaurant and bar ,but the rest of the hotel leaves a little to be desired small basic rooms lacking facilities and most of all hugely inflated prices even by 5 star standards 300 + euro ( depending on wine ) for dinner in la teresa ,even though it has 1 michelan star it is not in the class of top London eateries in anything but price.28 euros for a jack daniels and coke and it goes on . In summary underwelming and overpriced.If your thinking about staying at the Eden my advise would be choose 1 of the other many luxury hotels in the via veneto area and visit the Edens outdoor restaurant which has the same view as la teresa is served from the same kitchen in my opinion has better ambiance and is certainly better value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: RoadWorrier
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Eden while in Rome for business. It is in an excellent location, only a couple minutes walk to the Spanish Steps; the staff was attentive and polite; the food wonderful; the rooms large, airy, and climate controlled (never underestimate the importance of functional air conditioning). My room was equiped with high speed wired internet access and a comfortable desk. Not a single complaint from me. Next time I'm in Rome, I will look to stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Eden Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Ludovisi 49, 00187 Rome, Italy
